Dipper had dressed like a miniature Grunkle Stan, complete with eyepatch and gave the tours with Mabel as his valet. She just needed a way to steady her nerves after everything. Customers really ate up the sight of a cute tiny boy trying to astound and amaze, all while resisting his overly affectionate sister. The cute factor literally led to money being thrown at the pair.

The good news was that they made a boat load of cash. The bad news, once all deductions had been made for repairs, that boat load had been reduced to a single dollar.

At that exact moment, Stan entered the Shack wearing a Hawaiian shirt and a menacing grin. “Tick tock. Time’s up, kids. Nice to see you learned how to dress while I was gone.”

Mabel’s shoulders slumped, ready to accept defeat. “How much did you beat us by?”

“I won 300 thousand dollars!” It was like even the wind held its breath in shock as the Shack went dead silent. “And then…”

Coincidently, that episode was being played again on TV and everyone gathered around to watch. Stan was set to either walk away rich, or risk it all to become doubly rich. Ever the gambler, he chose the latter. The riddle was a six letter word used to ask for things nicely. It was so easy as to border on the obscene. What none of them knew was that Stan’s wild and crass behavior had brought unprecedented ratings to the show. The executives were also gambling that such a rude man would either not know the word and lose everything, or that he’d guess correctly and in celebration, cause the kind of scene that apparently audiences loved. Ultimately, however, he lost.

“Apparently that word can make you money,” Stan said, mourning his loss.

Dipper turned to his sister. “Mabel, you won!” Everyone but the old man cheered.

“Wait, what did we win again?” asked Soos.

“Well according to our bet, I guess Mabel’s the new… boss?” The old man was then bombarded with ‘no’s.

Mabel removed her fez. “Grunkle Stan, I had no idea how hard it was being boss. This place was coco bananas until I started barking orders like you.”

Stan beamed in pride as he accepted the fez back. “Yeah, well I gotta admit.” He pulled the twins into a hug. “Kinda nice ta be back, ya know.” Meeting his sappy quotient for the day, he pushed them away before turning to his employees. “Soos. Wendy. Get back to work!” He cleared his throat and adopted a more civil tone. “Please. Erhem. Still hurts.” He grabbed his chest, finally noticing the other girls. “And what are you doing here?”

“I knocked a monster’s tooth out!” Her boast delivered, Grenda held up the tooth for inspection. “I’m gonna make it into a necklace and wear it for luck.”

“And I grabbed some nose hairs,” bragged Candy. “I will also make a lucky necklace.”

Their bits said, the girls ran off, eager to relax now that the adventure was over. Stan just watched them go, deciding he was better off not asking.

Dipper beamed. “Mabel, didn’t your bet also say something about the loser doing an apology dance?”

“Uh, n-no. No it didn’t,” denied Stan.

“Actually yeah. I’ve got it in my notes here,” Mabel said, flipping through her planner.

“That never happened!” Stan screamed in desperation, only to spy Wendy laughing at his plight.

“I’ll get my camera.”

Stan tried to run, but was promptly hunted down and lassoed by Wendy. Begrudgingly he submitted to the song and dance. The crew had to go through multiple takes, on account of laughing so hard that they kept interrupting the film.

With everything finally calmed down, the youngest members of the Shack crew leaned against the counter, sank down to the floor, and collectively exhaled.

“So that’s the kind of stuff you guys were getting into behind my back,” Wendy said, staring up at the ceiling.

Mabel giggled. “Nah. Not even close.” At Wendy’s raised eyebrow, she added, “Sometimes it gets weird.”

Wendy burst out laughing and sunk further down until she was on level with the shoulder sitter. “And here I thought this would be just another boring summer. Turns out, I’ve been missing out.”

“Does this mean you want to do this again?” Dipper asked, his desperation like a neon sign.

Wendy smiled sweetly. “You know what. Yeah. I think I will. All my life my dad’s been telling me stories, and then you came along and told some stories. I think it’s about time Wendy Corduroy got some stories of her own to tell.” She offered out her fist, which both twins bumped. “Well, I’m pooped. Think I’ll go home and sleep for a day or two.” She waved as she left. “Don’t call me unless it’s something fun, or you’re just bored, or whatever.” The bell rang as the door closed on the way out.

“Looks like we’ve got Wendy along for the ride,” observed Mabel. “I wonder if there are stories about people enduring harrowing ordeals leading to stronger bonds,” she said facetiously.

Dipper scooted over until he was less than an inch from Mabel’s neck, and then let his head drop beside her. “Eh. Probably a bunch of new age garbage. I wouldn’t look too hard into it.” He sighed tiredly, feeling his eyelids grow heavy. The minizora yawned, and it didn’t take long for his sister to follow. “You’re the best, Mabel.”

“Yeah, I know.”
1152111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Master of the Shack

1152111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Wendy just sat there, looking very upset. Rather, she was in the sitting position. Kind of hard to sit down when you didn’t know where the ground was. With everyone pointed in different directions, the only reason any of them could agree on which direction was down was because that’s where all the air was blowing from. She, Soos, Mabel, Dipper, and Stan had been falling through this empty black void for a while now. With no bottom in sight, Wendy had quickly grown bored; the worst mental state a teenager could imagine. “You know, when I said I wanted to go on adventures with you guys, this isn’t what I had in mind.”

Mabel shrugged. “Hey, that’s what you get when you hang with the mystery twins. Every day is a new surprise. And hey, we can just make believe we’re astronauts floating through space.”

“For all we know, that might be where we are,” Dipper offered from Mabel’s closed hand, trying to stare into the void. “Oh hey. I found your shoes, Soos.”

“Cool. Thanks, dude.” He reached out and slipped them back on. “And look. There are the love letters from li’l Gideon.”

As Mabel fumed, Wendy finally found something to laugh at. “I know we were supposed to throw away things we didn’t want, but listen to the pro, Mabel. Fire’s way more satisfying. Its relaxing while you pretend to watch the twerp burn.”

“You have so much wisdom to share,” awed Mabel.

“Pssh. I could’ve told you that,” Stan groused.

“Yeah? Your ex-wife tell you that one?” sniped Wendy.

“Hey, shut it little missy. I’m your boss and you’re still on the clock.”

“What clock? We’ve been falling for, what, an hour? Are we even still in the same country anymore? You ain’t got no authority over me, old man.”

“Oh yeah?” snarled Stan. “Well how ‘bout I come over there and show you just what I-”

“Dudes! Dudes. Chill,” Soos urged, getting between the two. “Fighting solves nothing. Well, except for all the times that it does. Come to think of it, I think fighting might actually resolve most problems.”

“So is that a yay or a nay on me kicking the old man’s butt?” Wendy asked.

“Ha! Try it, girly. I’ve been imprisoned in countries you probably can’t even name.”

“Guys, calm down,” Mabel urged. “You’re just stressed cuz you’re focusing on the negative stuff. Maybe you just need a distraction to take your mind off life’s little problems, like how we might be down here forever.”

Dead silence.

“I vote we tell stories,” Dipper announced to unanimous support. He decided to start them off with a tale called Voice Over. It began with everyone poking fun of him for his crackling puberty voice. They even made a techno remix about it. Dipper fumed as everyone around him snickered at the memory. Anyway, he was walking down the road when old man McGucket sprang out, saying he’d overheard Dipper’s plight and had a solution. He’d been tinkerizin’ on a tonic to fix his own horrifying voice and figured that Dipper would want to try it. Like an idiot, the minizora took the strange drink from the crazy old man. The good news was that it worked. The bad news was that he sounded like a TV announcer. Mabel was so freaked out that she started screaming bloody murder and almost beat him with a nine iron. As problems built up over the day, Dipper eventually came to accept that his natural voice was preferable and let the tonic wear off. The end.

In her frustration, Wendy kicked at the open air. “I missed that? How do I keep missing these things? That sounds like it was hilarious.”

“It really wasn’t,” Mabel countered. “Soos, how about you go next.”

“Sure thing, dudes.” Soos’ Really Great Pinball Story began on a slow night at the Shack. While he was trying to get the high score on the pinball machine, the twins decided to help him out by tilting it. And by twins, he meant mostly Mabel. However, the cowboy skull in the machine didn’t take too kindly to that. It was alive, maybe magic, and had the power to transport the three of them into the machine. At first, it seemed like it might be fun, even with Dipper having proportionally shrunk. However, the cowboy skull was seeking vengeance for all the times he’d been tilted. With the world itself against them, the only solution was for Soos to sneak into the manual power switch and shut it off. At first he was hesitant, viewing this high score as possibly the greatest accomplishment of his life. Then he stopped being stupid and saved the kids, saying that their friendship and lives mattered more. The end.

“So, what did you guys do with the machine?” asked Wendy.

“It’s still there, just unplugged,” answered Soos. “Without power, it’s harmless. He’s just gonna sit there, forever, in whatever passes for sleep for video games, possibly like a coma.”

“Well that got dark,” Stan laughed. “But seriously. Magic tonics and Soos winning at something? Where do you come up with this stuff? I’ll tell you a real story.” Stan’s tale was less a tale and more a yarn he was clearly spinning on the spot. He singlehandedly won a championship game, earned the respect of the young pros, and also there was a robot that Stan had built himself. The end.

“Boo,” booed everyone.

“What? That story was great. I even threw in a talking robot for the kids.”

“Even if that were true, I’d be glad to sleep through that one,” huffed Wendy, eyeing Mabel holding and petting her brother. “Say, can I get a turn? Petting something cute sounds like a great way to relax right now.”

Mabel looked hesitantly between Dipper and Wendy, but eventually sighed her acceptance. “We can share.”

“Cool!” Wendy swam through the air until she was beside Mabel and tenderly touched her fingers to Dipper’s sides. Despite having felt him before, touching this tiny person still felt novel. He felt so delicate, yet she knew him to be one tough cookie. The contrast was so ridiculous that it got her to start giggling as she poked his belly, which in turn made him burst out laughing. Having discovered his laugh button, Wendy did what any teen in her position would do and abused the hell out of it.

“I think it’s my turn now,” Mabel said, keeping a possessive hold on her brother. “This is a non-terrible story. A story called Trooth Ache.” Stan had just bought a bear delivered by Manly Dan, which Stan was planning to teach to drive. It started out well enough, actually. However, after blatantly lying to the cops, Mabel had had enough of Stan’s deceit. She was convinced that lying was always wrong and that Stan needed to be forced to see the light. So, after acquiring some magic teeth – using means that she discretely omitted from the story – Mabel got exactly what she wished for. Regret was immediate and scarring. Stan started insulting people more often, admitting to behaviors that were inappropriate for children to hear, and sharing his deepest and darkest thoughts without any prompting. It was a nightmare for all involved. Things finally came to a head when the cops returned and Mabel was forced to lie to protect Stan from his own honesty. The teeth were confiscated, locked in a trunk, and then dumped into the Bottomless Pit, never to be seen again.

“Oh, there it is.”

Everyone groaned.

“So dad did wrestle a bear,” Wendy realized. “Huh. The more I hear, the more I wonder if I’ve had invisible blinders on all my life and they’ve only just come off.”

That’s when they finally saw something. Directly below the group was a bright white light and it was coming up fast. Everyone braced themselves for the worst. What they got was being spat back out from the hole onto the adjacent ground. With everyone piled on top of one another, somehow Mabel’s hand – the one that held Dipper – had found its way down Wendy’s shirt. 115211111111111112.content:
Mable returned to her shared room in the Mystery Shack with Dipper clutched to her chest. She had been holding him firmly to her chest since she rescued him, refusing to let go as she ground him into her still-growing breasts. Dipper squirmed in her grasp; he was pretty sure he had some rug burns from being forced against Mable’s scratchy sweater so long. Mable refused to let go of her brother until she could dump him directly onto her bed.

“Are you sure you’re okay? Quickly! Take everything off and let me examine you! Even the tiniest scratch must be treated!” Mable said as she grabbed Dipper by the back of his shirt, lifting him up as she tried to yank it off him. Having enough of her dramatics, Dipper squirmed his way out of his top and landed on his feet with his hands held over his head.

“Hold on! Cool it, Mable. I’m just fine. I’ve been through much worse than what the creepy Muppet tried to do to me. There is no reason to freak out,” he stressed, giving his bigger twin a serious look. Seriously, he had survived a lot worse through the years. Like the time he got grabbed up off the ground by a bird and taken halfway across the town. It had taken two days for him to manage his way back home. Then there was the time he accidentally got stuck to some bubble-gum under the school lunch table and was trapped until the cleaning staff found him that night. Heck, the gnomes, fake Gobblewonker, and the wax men were all as dangerous as Gideon if not more dangerous. So why was Mable so worked up about this?

“It’s just…it’s just…” Mable stammered before her shoulder’s slumped and she averted her eyes from Dipper. “If you got hurt it would be my fault. Everything that happened to you happened because I wasn’t strong enough to stand up for myself and you tried to help. If you ever got hurt because of me, I’d never forgive myself.”

“Mable, it wasn’t your fault,” Dipper tried to say but he didn’t think she heard him. Tears started running from Mable bright, big eyes, flowing down her round cheeks and Dipper could only yelp as they dripped right down on top of him. Great, not only was his sister sad, but he was wet now too.

Seeing that Mable was too upset to hear him, Dipper decided to act. Backing up he ran from the edge of the bed as fast as he could and jumped off of it, rocketing right towards Mable’s right let. With a gasp, he landed on her ankle above her shoe and grasped hard to the area as he closed his eyes and squeezed. Mable blinked away her tears when she felt something puny clinging to her leg. She looked down at Dipper as he continued to grab hold of her ankle for dear life. All she could do was ask, “what are you doing?”

“I’m trying to hug you!” Dipper said as he nearly lost his grip and had to try and wrap his legs around Mable’s ankle to stay attached to her. Mable just looked down at her tiny brother as he clung to her leg like a bug as he tried to show her he cared. At first, she was touched by how hard he was trying, then she realized how silly he looked and started to giggle.

“Silly little brother, that’s not how you give a hug.” Mable reached down, pulling the tiny boy off her and bringing him to her face. She cupped him against her warm, soft cheek as he spread his arms and spread his arms out as far as they could. He hugged her face for a minute as Mable cradled him, no more tears coming out as she just held tightly to the most important thing in her life. When she finally let go, Mable was smiling and nervously laughing.

“I guess I overreacted just a little bit. I just felt so bad about what happened to you,” Mable said as she sat down on her bed, holding Dipper close to her face as she apologized. Blushing slightly, she bit her lower lip as she hoped Dipper didn’t think she was acting like a big, overcontrolling baby after her little crying fit.

“It’s no big deal. I’ve been manhandled a lot worse by you when you’re on a sugar rush,” Dipper said as though he hadn’t nearly died. He was just happy to see Mable was happy again.

“Hey, I’m very safe with you all the time,” Mable defensively said before rethinking her words. “Except for that one time I thought I could tie you to my hair and use you as an accessory.”

“I remember that I never knew you had so much talent with tying knots. Not so much talent with untying knots,” Dipper complained, rubbing his wrists as he remembered that one experience. After eating half her weight in gummy worms, Mable thought that if he was stuck to a braid in her hair, he would be safe with her always and she wouldn’t have to worry about holding him. She ignored the millions of reasons that was a bad idea and tied Dipper up with her long, flowing brown hair. It wasn’t that bad at first until he had to go to the bathroom, and she couldn’t get him out. Thus, ended Dipper’s time as Mable’s hair accessory.

“I’ve gotten better. When I get a boyfriend, I’ll show you how my knot tying skills have grown,” Mable proudly said as Dipper just stared at her. What she said could be taken in two different ways. She could either be talking about how once she gets a guy, she’ll tie him down like a serial killer so he can’t escape her, or she meant it relating to the kinky games she had planned once she had a man. Dipper wasn’t sure which she meant, or which was more disturbing.

With everything calmed down, Mable put Dipper down and started to undress to get ready for bed. After she had her sweater off, she pulled down her pants and something fell from her pocket onto the floor with a clink. In just her underwear, Mable picked it up and frowned when she saw what it was before a smile overtook her face. Dipper looked up and saw that what Mable was holding was Gideon’s now cracked amulet which she must have taken after destroying it.

“Looks like I have something new to add to my adventure souvenir collection,” Mable giggled as she twirled the magical artifact around before grabbing a box from her closet. She dropped the amulet into the box and was going to put it away again when Dipper peered over her shoulder and saw several other items stashed away.

“What do you got there?” He asked, curious what Mable had been keeping since they arrived in Gravity Falls.

“Nothing much, just some mementos from our adventures. Here take a look.” Mable said as she dropped the box down right beside the minizora, nearly making him jump back as the giant object landed inches from him. Mable reached in and first pulled out a jar that was filled by some kind of rainbow-colored fluid. It was very pretty. “I went back after we took out the gnomes and found this. I think it’s gnome puke.”

“Fascinating and gross,” Dipper said after a moment to think about it. “Mostly gross.”

“Here are some pictures I managed to save from our adventure hunting the Gobblewonker.” Multiple polaroids were shown to Dipper, none with the mechanical sea monster just him. It would be touching that Mable saved these pictures of him and the part of the adventure she most remembered was spending with him. However, all the pictures were terrible, absolutely terrible.

“Never show those to anyone. Never, ever, ever show anyone,” Dipper said in a no-nonsense tone. Each picture captured Dipper in a humiliating pose. There was one where he was flying through the air, arms waving around as his mouth open hung open in terror and his eyes bugged out. Another was just a close up of him landing face-first on the ground, butt up in the air. The worse was the one Mable had somehow taken when he was in her mouth, clutching her tongue for dear life as drool went flying everywhere. “And my favorite souvenir of all, Wax Dipper!” What Mable pulled out first made Dipper recoil and then just gawk at in confusion. It was a life-sized wax sculpture of him but not really him. Wax Dipper had his hat on backward and was wearing these really obnoxious sunglasses and riding a skateboard as he gave a double thumbs up. He just looked strange and for some reason, Dipper had the urge to rip him limb from limb.

“After we dealt with the cursed wax sculptures, we had all this melted wax lying around and I thought what better way to remember this adventure than to use the melted corpses of our defeated enemies to make another you. Now we are triples!” Mable explained, very pleased with herself. Lowering the wax statue down to Dipper he had to admit as annoying as Wax dipper looked, he was very well done. Mable had sculpted and pained him with so much detail, it was truly impressive. Touching his frozen clone, Dipper noticed something.

“Why is he so sticky?” Wax statues were usually smoother but this one was covered in something very thick and gooey. He also noticed a vaguely familiar smell.

“Enough questions, time for bed,” Mable said as she dumped everything back into the box, except wax Dipper. With her back turned to her brother, he had to watch her closely to see her covertly pulling the front of her panties out and drop in his homemade clone. Stashing everything away, Mable returned to bed, her smile a bit wider as she adjusted her panties, so her creation was nestled firmly where she wanted it. Placing Dipper on his bed, Mable quickly turned herself in, her hands moving discreetly under her blanket towards her womanhood. Dipper just shook his head in disbelief.

“Good to see Mable’s back to normal.” As he muttered that he noticed his dick was starting to swell as he thought about what Mable was doing and he sighed. His hands moving discreetly under the blanket towards his manhood. Everything was normal between the twins again.

11532.title: My Hero Academia

1153211.content:
Izuku Midoriya yelped as he avoided a foot that came too close to stomping on him. Catching his breath, the young man looked around, trying to figure out where he was. Life was hard when you didn’t have a Quirk, but it was a hundred times harder when you were also a minizora. Izuku had never heard of another minizora that didn’t also have some kind of Quirk to help them survive be it flight or super climbing skills. Just his luck that he ended up tiny and without any powers.

“Excuse me, could you tell me where I am?” He called out to the person walking right up to him, and then dived out of the way to avoid being crushed under a size 9 shoe. Groaning, Izuku moved away from the street to safety, more worried than ever. He had accidentally got caught in someone’s shoelace after class and dragged into downtown before he got untangled. Utterly lost, he had tried to get help but either no one noticed him, or no one cared. What the minizora boy needed was a hero and unfortunately, there didn’t seem to be any of them around.

“It’s hopeless,” Izuku muttered, his enthusiasm crushed by the absolute mess he had gotten himself into. He had once dreamed about becoming a hero, one that saved people with a smile like his hero All-Might, but how could he save anyone when he couldn’t even survive walking down the street without getting into danger. He really was useless.

“Hey kid, you okay?” a soft, feminine voice called out from above Izuku. Pulling himself from his despair, Izuku looked up, way up and saw a woman standing over him, her features hidden by the sunlight spilling in around her. With renewed hope, Izuku reached up to the woman, praying his luck had changed.

“No. I’m lost, do you think you might be able to help me,” he said, hopeful again that he might be saved. The woman responded with a short laugh.

“Of course, I’ll help you, what kind of hero would I be if I left you all alone?.” She knelt down, offering her open hand for Izuku to climb aboard. Smiling spreading across his face, Izuku jumped on eagerly. He couldn’t believe it, a real-life hero. Maybe things were finally looking up for him.

He had valiantly tried to explain that the machine zombies had been sent back in time from Venus, but the locals hadn’t put down their pitchforks or torches. Overall, it could have gone a lot worse.

“Did we make it?” A soft voice called out from the Doctor’s pocket. Reaching in, the Doctor pushed aside a yoyo, several balls of yarn and his sonic screwdriver to pull out a very small ginger.

“Well, I’m not being burned at the stake, so I think we are alright,” he told a very disheveled Amy Pond. The poor girl had been tossed in his pocket during the craziness and been tossed around. Her hair was a mess and her skirt, which she now regretted wearing today, was up leaving her underwear exposed. As she fixed her outfit, she gazed up at the Doctor with slight annoyance.

“Did you have to manhandle me like that? You know I hate staying in your pockets, too deep, dark and full of junk,” Amy bemoaned as she straightened up in the Doctor’s hand. “Sorry, sorry, I was in a rush. At least I didn’t accidentally drop you into my pants this time,” the Doctor apologized. Amy snapped her mouth closed at that comment, a small, dreamy smile forming on her face. Not all the places she got stuck were that bad.

“So where to now? The past, the future or do you need to stop off in the present?” The Doctor asked as he swaggered over to the controls, bringing them out of medieval France and into the unknown. Watto the toydarian groans, he needed to get the minizora brat off his hands, sure Anakins tiny size made him useful when examining droid circuitry, but he was no actual use in the shop and he needed to be kept under watch of his mother most of the time. There were times he considered just losing him in the deserts of Tatooine, but knew that would just be a waste and more trouble than it was worth. No, he needed to get ride of him legally, his problem was nobody wanted a slave who needed more care than he was capable of giving, which was one of the reasons there were so few quarian slaves, suit maintenance made them difficult to keep.

Luckily his prays were about to be answered

1) One of the Queens aides had made a stop in Tatooine for cheep parts, and offers to buy Anakin as a gift for Padme's birthday/coronation
2) during Episode 1, Wato sees Padme intruiged by the little tech gremlin, so offers to trade him for the necklace she'd forgotten to remove before getting off the ship, knowing the individual gems were probably worth more than the boy to the right people
3) one of the Trade Federation, buys him to add his ownership/contract as an extra line to their treaty, as a apparent gesture of compliance, as well as middle finger to the Queen, as she was now both a slave owner, and needed to care for and train the small boy she was about to receive.
124321111.title: Padmes pet slave boy

choices: I'm going to have fun with this
1243211111.content:
Watto turn when he hears the hiss of the shop door, smirking when he sees someone who was clearly a Republic man, as well as 2 of his staff, most likely bodyguards.l "What can I do for you ah? Just remember, the Outer Rim doesn't take Republic credits"

The older gentleman nods with a polite chuckle "of course, we came perpared" he reaches into his pocket and pulls out a bag of jewels "these good?"

"They should we'll see when you're making the purchase. Now whata you want?"

"Specific engine parts for our diplomatic vessels, particularly the hyperdrive, and Tatoine is the best place to go with involving the Trade Federation, with barely any dip in quality" he explains handing over the list of materials to the toydarian who hums

"I got some of these parts, others will need to be ordered in" he grunts, then notices the mans attention was elsewhere, also catching Anakin out the corner of his eye "what, you don't have minizora on your planet?"

"We do but they're quite uncommon, about .1% of the population"

An idea lit up in his mind "Want the boy? I can add him to the price of your parts, even throw him in at a discount"

The man frowns "why? Is there something wrong with him?" He asks

"No not really, just his size. On a planet like this minis like him are difficult to deal with, I have no problem parting with a slave I have no work for. I'm sure you can find a use for him"

The man frowns, considering the offer "the princess has her birthday coming up in a couple weeks"

"A yes, royals have many servents, I'm sure she will find something for little Ani to do" Watto laughs, then after checking the gems were good he gave the man ownership of Anakin, as well as tranfer papers for a Padme Amadala, the true recipient.

Later

"You have one last gift your highness" one of her hand maidens reminds her, Padme sighs before receiving the small package, noting it was labelled and had been transported as live cargo, curious about what it could be. Opening the lid she yelps as she sees a tiny person scurrying around inside, she'd been gifted a tiny person...

How does that go?

1) she adamantly shows her anger and disgust at owning a person, until she sees his reaction, like she'd knocked him to the floor and stomped on his minuscule form. Feeling bad she agrees to keep him, maybe he can help her retainers make her look good
2) Padme smiles at the cute boy, realising this was the chance to have a real friend, someone she doesn't have to be the princess/soon to be Queen to all the time.
3) there was a wide grin on her face, she was still a teenager after all and as a young royal was used to people doing what she says, she's sure she can find things to do, some that are fun for them both but all fun for her. She'll take good care of her slave/toy, she wants him to last after all, she has the feeling this cutie will be quite handsome when he grows up.
1243211111.title: A surprising gift

choices: An interesting master-padawan dynamic (older Ahsoka, about 16-17ish)
124321112.content:
One last choice chapter before we get things going!

1) It's the first time Ahsoka Tano meets her new, teeny tiny master. She'd heard quite a bit about this 'Master Skywalker', but was especially interested in the fact he was a 3-inch tall Minizora. That being said...she's incredibly curious about what she could do with a 'master' that is smaller than her ankle...

2) Ahsoka's been Anakin's Padawan for quite a while. And while at first she was skeptical about the power a 3-inch tall Minizora Jedi could have, she's been proven wrong on many occasions. Still, given Ahsoka's own status as a bit of a prodigy, and the fact she stands roughly 5'7" (over twenty times as tall) it's quite clear who is the real 'leader' of the pair. So while she is a lot more respectful towards Anakin than she used to....he is still her toy-sized master....and she is a young Togruta lady in her late teens...
124321112.title: Ahsokas teeny master

choices: The council is fucking with me
Let's see what happens, shall we?
1243211121.content:
Ahsoka Tano, Togruta Jedi youngling made her way through the temple, just barely managing to hold in a very unwanted squee or cheer. She'd been chosen, Yoda himself had handpicked her to be a padawan, potentially years ahead of her fellow learners. She knew just how big a deal this was and promised herself she would be on her best behavior, by the Force she'd be the best Padawan her Master could ever want.

Entering the meeting chamber a little happy squeak left her throat before she clamped her hands over her mouth, but who could blame her when her teacher was going to be Obi Wan Kenobi. Ordinarily she'd assume his turning to face her was because of his sensing her through the Force, but she very clearly gave away her position though if his kind smile and chuckle were any indication he didn't mind it appeared she needed to work on being stealthy.

"Greetings Master Kenobi, it is an honor to be your padawan" she says calmly, bowing her head and trying to be respectful. So him laughing didn't exactly help her nerves, nor her bubbling emotions

"Sorry youngling... I mean Miss Tano, but I'm not your Jedi Master, I'm simply here making sure my former Padawan actually showed up to meet his first" the older Jedi smiles before sidestepping revealing a desk and to the togruta's surprise a Minizora. She'd heard about them, and that some were force sensitive (when she'd first heard about the Jedi taking in mini's as padawan she'd been nervously watching her step for nearly a month) but a Minizoran Jedi knight? "This man here, is Anakin Skywalker, Anakin as you already heard, this is your Padawan, Miss Ahsoka Tano" Kenobi introduces, the mini looking unimpressed as far as the young Togruta could tell

1) Ahsoka can't hold in the giggles at the idea of the tiny thing in front of her being her master, thinking the Jedi council were pulling some kind of prank... until she remembered they lacked a sense of humor, which sent her mood into a nosedive faster than anything Anakin of any universe has ever flown
2) Annoyed by what she feels is a slight on her skills and pride, once Anakin and Ahsoka are alone she sets the record straight in her mind: He needs to prove to her why she should listen to him and follow any orders he gives... because if he can't, well she's been having very 'un-jedi' thoughts since she saw him standing level with her rapidly developing hips.
3) Seeing as he must be a good Jedi if he was a knight despite his 'disadvantages' Ahsoka decides to play it by ear, maybe Master Skywalker will be just the teacher she needs, or maybe he'll be a better stress reliever... only time will tell.
1243211121.title: First meeting... not exactly a good start

124321131.content:
Padmé Amidala is born a Minizora, four inches tall but still a Queen.

What's the situation for Padmé Amidala?

1) Padme is on her way to a council meeting but her and her guards are attacked and killed. Padme ends up kidnapped and is now on the black market being sold as a pet, toy or whatever to the heighest buyer.

2) Padme and Qui-Gon Jinn are on their way to Tatooine to see Anakin.
124321131.title: Padmé Amidala Options

1243211311.content:
Padmé Amidala wakes up with her ears ringing and vision blurring. She does her best to stand up but ends up falling over. Laying on her back she takes a couple of deep breaths.

“Just breathe.” She whispers to herself.

She lays there for a couple of minutes as the ringing calms down and her vision comes to. Upon the awakening she notices something strange above her. It looks to be bars. Padmes stomach drops, she knows what she is in. She jumps up and looks around, she’s in a cage with a lock at the front that requires a key to be unlocked.

“This can’t be happening,” Padme says almost having a panic attack. “This can’t be happening.”

Looking around her surroundings doesn’t help, there are other creatures in cages. She’s in a illegal market shop where they sell creatures and possibly Minizoras. Padme has only heard things about the black market but never actually seen one herself. She’s tried to put a law in motion but it somehow always manages to slip though the cracks and stay alive.

Padme tries thinking back on how she could have gotten here.

Earlier that day Padme and her soldiers were on their way to meet up with another council to discuss the current climate of their situations, any policies that need to be updating and to see where they are at. On their way Padme and her crew were attacked, during the attack a lot of her guards were killed and Padme did her best to escape. The last thing she remembers is blacking out. One of the attackers must have kidnaped her.

“About time you woke up.” Padme looks up and sees the face of an ugly Crolute grinning down at her.

“Release me this instant!” Padme commands.

“Not a chance.” The Crolute says. “I paid good money for you and will make me a fortune. Do you know how much queens and kings sell on the market?”

“You can’t do this,” Padme bellows. “This is inhumane, selling humans on the black market is illegal and I can get you arrested.”

“And here you are in a cage and being sold.” The Crolute grins. “Now shut up and present yourself, a queen would make good money here.”

Padme cowers in fear as his face gets close. Without her guards around her she feels powerless. Everyone would assume she is dead after the attack so she isn’t sure if there would be a search for her since there were hardly any survivors after the attack. Padme does her best to hold back tears. Hours roll by with Padme holding herself in the corner of the cage whimpering.

“Shut up.” The Crolute shouts hitting the cage. “I have a buyer here who wants you.”

Padme squeaks and freezes, she could be in real trouble or run into someone who can help her. She hopes it’s the ladder. The cage is picked up and is brought to the front of the store. Padme looks over and sees that the buyer is…
1243211311.title: Padmé Amidala on the Black Market

12432113113.content: Who else is interested in buying Padme?
12432113113.title: More Options at the Black Market

choices: Barris has to go to work
Barris has to pick up a friend
124321131131.content:
Padme looks up and sees the face of a female Togruta. She looks to be in her late twenties. Padme starts shaking as her big blue eyes lock onto her and smiles widely. Padme starts to whimper as she is expecting the worst.

“Thank you.” The Togruta says and hands the keeper the money.

The Togruta gives Padme a soft smile before heading off with her. Padme curls up in the corner of the cage shaking. Padme does her best to avoid eye contact with the Togruta but something about her catches her eye. Padme relaxes slightly and looks up at her. She looks a little familiar, she can’t exactly figure out where she has seen her before but Padme knows that they have met. She can’t quite put a finger on it.

The journey to the female’s place does take quite a while, but on the journey there Padme felt how familiar all of this was. While both of them were quite the whole way there, the sense of security felt familiar. From her expressions and movements it was clear that this woman had no intention of hurting her. Padme smiles softly to herself and see that they have arrived on a small ship.

“Welcome to my home.” The woman says and gently places the cage on a table.

She sits down on a chair in front of her and opens the cage door. Padme looks over at the woman who is giving her a big friendly smile. Padme blushes and softly smiles back. She stands up and walks out of the cage slowly.

“Just take your time Padme.” The woman says softly.

Padme would question how she knew her but she is the queen after all. Padme climbs out and gives the woman a soft smile.

“Are you okay Padme?” She asks. “I heard what had happened with your guards and when I saw you in that shop I had to buy you incase you fell into the wrong hands.”

“I am thanks.” Padme smiles. “Thanks for saving me I guess.”

“You’re welcome.” She smiles. “I never thought we’d run into each other again like this.”

“What do you mean?” Padme asks.  
“You don’t remember me?” She asks.

“I think I do.” Padme says. “I mean you do look familiar it’s just that I don’t remember where I know you from.”

“I used to be one of your guards.” She says softly. “I worked for you for seven years but I left about a year ago.”

“Barris?” Padme says with a smile.

“That’s it,” She smiles.

“Oh thank god.” Padme falls to her knees almost crying. “I’m so glad you are the one who found me. I’m so sorry I didn’t remember you.”

“It’s okay.” Barris smiles softly and brings her hands towards her. “I’m just glad you are safe. Is it okay if i….”

“Of course.” Padme smiles. “With everything that has been happening I think it warranted.”

Barris smiles and cups her hand around Padme, Padme smiles as she is brought closer. Barris lays Padme against her chest and gently hugs her. Padme closes her eyes and cries a little burring her face into her chest. She smiles a little when she feels Barris hold her close and gently rubs her back.

“It’s okay sweetie. I’m here for you.” She whispers.

Padme smiles a little then bursts into tears. After everything that has happened today it has all been bottling up inside of her and now she can let it all out. Padme cries for a solid five minutes as Barris holds her close and comforts her. Padme doesn’t remember the last time she had cried in front of someone or ever been this comfortable with someone. Barris didn’t speak as she just let Padme get it all out.

“Sorry about that.” Padme sniffs.

“It’s okay sweetie.” Barris smiles and hands her a cloth. “You’ve had a big day and need to get it all out.”

Padme smiles and wipes her nose and tears while her head still gently rests on Barris’s chest.

“I don’t know why I ever let you go.” Padme says.

“You didn’t let me go. I left myself.” Barris says.

“That’s right, I don’t remember you giving a reason.” Padme says.

“I didn’t.” Barris says.

“May I ask why?” Padme asks.

“I felt like my time was up.” Barris sighs. “Not that I didn’t like being your guard I just didn’t want to do it forever. So when I left I became a mercenary.”

“I’m glad I didn’t hold you back.” Padme says.

“You didn’t.” Barris says. “I really enjoyed my time with you and I did learn a lot. On being a better person and being better at my job.”

“I’m glad I could help.” Padme smiles. “I’m sorry I didn’t remember you. If I did I could have been more of a help to you.”

“It’s alright sweetie.” Barris smiles. “You’re the queen and have a lot of things to look over as it is.”

Barris kisses the top of Padme’s head and blushes. Padme smiles and blushes too.

“Um, sorry about that.” Barris says turning bright red.

“It’s okay.” Padme smiles. “That felt kind of nice, I don’t remember the last time anyone showed me any affection because they care about me. A lot of people tend to treat me more as a queen than a person.”

“I’m glad I can help.” Barris smiles.

Padme smiles and snuggles into Barris more. Her chest is nice and warm she could easily drift off to sleep. She closes her eyes and gentle rubs Barris’s chest with her hands.

“You okay there?” Barris asks.

“I’m fine yeah.” Padme blushes.

“As much as I’d love to keep cuddling you sweetie I actually have to head off.” Barris says. She gently removes Padme from her chest and sets her down beside the cage.

“Where are you going?” Padme asks.


Where does Barris have to go?
124321131131.title: A Familiar Face

choices: Barris gets a call form work
Barris suggests they head out for a bit
1243211311312.content:
“I’ve got to go and pick my friend up from school.” Barris smiles.

“Who’s your fiend?” Padme asks.

“You’ll find out soon.” Barris smiles. “While I’m gone you should rest up.”

Barris pulls out a small bed for Minizora’s. She places it next to Padme and gives her a small blanket.

“You’ve had a big day sweetie and I think you should rest up.” Barris smiles.

“I will,” Padme smiles. “Thanks.”

Padme climbs into bed and wraps herself up in the blanket. Barris smiles and runs her finger down Padme’s back and gently rubs it. Padme smiles and moans, Barris giggles and gently tucks Padme in from each side so that she is comfortable.

“Rest up sweetie.” Barris smiles. “I won’t be gone long but I will lock the ship so no one can disturb you.”

“Thanks Barris.” Padme smiles.

As soon as Padme closes her eyes she falls right to sleep. She doesn’t hear Barris lock up and leave.

Padme wakes up feeling a lot more awake than she did before, because of how stressful the past twenty four hours was for her she was able to sleep well having the best sleep she’s had in a long time. Padme sits up and stretches, she looks around and sees Barris on the other side of the room talking to herself. Padme smiles and just watches her hugging her knees. She loves how kind and gentle Barris is towards her. Padme sees Barris smiling as her eyes dart to her. Padme blushes and looks away.

“Morning sweetie.” Barris smiles as she walks over to her. “How did you sleep?”

“Very well thanks.” Padme says. “What do you mean by morning?”

“You’ve been asleep for eighteen hours.” Barris says.

“Why didn’t you wake me?” Padme asks.

“Because you needed your sleep.” Barris says. “And you’ve very cute when you sleep.”

Padme blushes and smiles, she sees Barris’s hand descend beside the bed and a Minizora climbs off. He looks to be a couple of years younger than Padme with short brown hair and an average build and a little taller than Padme. Padme smiles as he looks kind of cute. The boy climbs off and stares at Padme in awe.

“Padme this is my friend Daveril.” Barris says giggling at his reaction.

“It’s nice to meet you Daveril.” Padme smiles still sitting in bed. “I’m Padme.”

“I know who you are my queen.” Daveril says kneeling in front of her. “Barris told me that we had a guest staying the night but she didn’t say anything about it being the queen. It’s nice to meet you your majesty.”

“It’s nice to meet you too.” Padme smiles. “And there’s no need for that.”

“Sorry,” Daveril blushes and stands up.

“So this is the friend you were telling me about?” Padme asks.

“Yes he is.” Barris smiles. “Sorry I didn’t tell either of you, just thought it would be a fun surprise for you two to meet and I was right.”

“You’re such an ass Barris.” Daveril grins.

“I know,” Barris smirks. “Only because it’s fun to tease you.”

Padme giggles and watches the two bicker, it was kind of cute to watch. It was obvious that these two are very comfortable with each other and Padme wonders why. “How long have you two been together?”

“Me and her?” Daveril says with his face screwed up. “Gross.”

“Im sure she didn’t mean it like that.” Barris laughs.

“I wasn’t sorry.” Padme blushes. “Just curious what your relationship was as you two look every comfortable and open with each other.”

“We are fiends,” Barris smiles. “But we are like family, I’ve been raising Daveril ever since he was thirteen.”

“How old are you now?” Padme asks.

“Seventeen.” He says.

“How come you didn’t tell me when you were working for me?” Padme asks. “I could have helped you two out.”

“It’s alright Padme, I like to keep my personal life and work life separate.” Barris says. “Besides, we never really ran into any serious problems. You turned out fine didn’t you Daveril?”

“I think so,” Darveil says. “I mean there’s still time to fuck me up.”

“Little shit,” Barris giggles and gives him a nudge.

“Barris has been great to me though,” Daveril smiles and sits down on the edge of the bed. “I do love her and am really happy she raised me. She’s like my Mom.”

“That’s so sweet,” Padme smiles. “So how did you two meet?”

“It’s in the past and I’m happy now so you don’t need to worry.” Daveril says as his smile quickly turns into a frown. “My parents were struggling to feed another mouth and raising me in general so they sold me on the black market. They got a lot of money for me and didn’t seem to care that I was gone.”

“I’m so sorry.” Padme says moving in closer. She places her hand on his back and gently rubs.

“Thanks.” Darveil smiles and blushes a little. “But it’s all in the past though, I don’t think too much of it anymore though. Barris found me and took me in and I couldn’t have asked for anyone better.”

“Well she did raise me in a way too so I can understand.” Padme smiles. “Was that your first job for me? Babysitting me?”

“It was yeah,” Barris smiles. “I think you were twelve when I was first looking after you, I then adopted Daveril three years after when he was thirteen. It was a great learning experience raising you two and I’m glad you turned out to be the beautiful and powerful leader and queen you are now.”

“I had a wonderful parent.” Padme smiles. “I think when you started to raise me that’s when my parents slowly drifted away from me. You became more of a parent to me than they did.”

“So does that mean the queen is like my sister?” Daveril laughs.

“We shared the same mother so I guess it kind of does.” Padme giggles.

“I don’t think you two should be siblings.” Barris smiles bringing her face closer to them.

“I finally have a sister and you’re going to ruin it for me?” Daveril says.

“Come on Barris.” Padme smiles. “Listen to my little bother.”

“You two can be if you want.” Barris smiles. “I just thought you two would make for such a cute couple thats all. You two being siblings would just make it a bit wired.”

Padme and Daveril blush and scotch away form each other a bit.

“There’s no need to be embarrassed.” Barris smiles. “You two are so adorable as it is and I love you both but you two would be so cute together. I can just imagine what you babies would look like.”

Padme and Daveril both turn bright red feeling a little embarrassed. Both move away and avoid eye contact form Barris.

“That would make you a grandmother.” Darveil smirks.

“I can live with that.” Barris smiles.

Padme and Darveil both laugh along with Barris. Padme blushes even more and sees Daveril out of the corner of her, both of them make eye contact and blush a little more.
1243211311312.title: Padme: New Hope

12432113113121.content:
Padme looks up at Barris still blushing, Barris gives Padme a soft smile causing Padme to blush a lot more. Padme’s eyes dart away causing Barris to giggle a bit. A noise goes off in the background making Padme jump.

“It’s okay Padme,” Barris says. “It’s just my communicator.”

Barris stands up and goes and answers it, she sits down and talks to the person on the other side. Padme can’t make out what she is saying. She just sits there silently beside Daveril giving each other the occasional glance and blush.

“You know she is just kidding right?” Daveril says.

“I do yeah,” Padme smirks.

“She’s always teasing me about that kind of thing.” Daveril says.

“How many girlfriends do you have then?” Padme smirks.

“I don’t have any.” Daveril blushes. “I just hate when she does that.”

“So you wouldn’t want to be with me?” Padme smirks.

“It’s not that,” Darveril blushes. “I mean I wouldn’t say no or anything.”

“I’m only teasing.” Padme says.

“Sorry.” Daveril smiles.

“Regardless of Barris trying to play matchmaker I would like to be friends with you.” Padme says. “You are a very sweet boy that I’d like to get to know.”

“Same here.” Darveril smiles. “Can we just forget all that and start over?”

“Sounds good,” Padme smiles. “I'm Padme.”

“I’m Daveril.” He smiles back. “It’s nice to meet you.”

“It’s nice to meet you too.” Padme smiles back.

The two of them smile and blush as they stare into each others eyes, they can’t describe it but there is a little connection between them already. Daveril breaks eye contact with his eyes darting around a bit blushing slightly. Padme giggles a little and blushes too. They hear Barris approach and see her with a worried expression.

“Everything okay?” Daveril asks.

“Not really.” She sighs sitting down in front of them. “I just had a call from Arris about yesterdays attack.”

“What’s the verdict?” Padme asks scotching closer.

“Five have been caught but the rest are still out there,” Barris explains. “They five who have been caught refuse to give up any information but all we know is that they are looking for you and that there is a lot more out there.”

“Why would they be looking for Padme?” Daveril asks.

“Only reason I can think of is that I’m the queen.” Padme sighs. “I did get a look at them before I was kidnapped by that marketer, I didn’t recognise any of them.”

Padme pulls her knees towards her and starts to shake at the thought of being hunted. She rests her chin on her knees and takes a deep breath doing her best to hold in all her angry and frustration. Padme feels two arms wrap around her, she looks over and sees that it’s Darveril. Padme gives him a soft smile and rests her head on his shoulder as a few tears roll down her cheek. Padme closes her eyes and leans into his tender embrace. Padme opens her eyes sightly and sees Barris with a soft look on her face.

“I know you probably don’t want to hear this but I think you should stay with us until all of this gets sorted.” Barris says.

“You are probably right.” Padme sighs. “But at lest I’m in a good place.”

“You are.” Barris smiles. “And I promise you that Daveril and I will take good care of you and make you feel at home. Wont we?”

“Of course we will.” Daveril smiles.

“Thanks.” Padme smiles.

Barris smiles back and gently strokes the Padme’s back. Padme closes her eyes and lets out a soft moan. Daveril’s hug and Barris’s gentle stokes feels nice and makes Padme feel nice and warm. She doesn’t remember the last time she had felt this way.



1. Barris has to head out as she is helping out hunting these criminals down. Padme and Daveril stay behind and bond.
2. Barris suggests for them to do something to get their minds off all of this.
3. Barris heads out but takes Padme and Daveril with her

choices: An Alien wanting her for Money
12432131.content:
(Takes place near the beginning of the Force Awakens)

It's early hours in the morning on Jakku with the sun just peeking up from the horizon. Rey ventures out for the day looking for anything she could use to survive, food, water scraps she could trade in. Anything that could be of use for her. She heads though the open land of sand with her staff and bag on her back.

Rey had been left of Jakku for over a decade now and she was forced to take care of herself. She's born a minizora but never let herself be brought down by that, most of the time it would come in handy. Rey could normally reach places that no one else could and she usually finds some very unusual but useful things. Once she found something quite peculiar, she couldn't quite make out what it was but when she traded it in she managed to use that profit to feed herself for two weeks.

After walking for what feels like hours trekking though miles of sand, Rey stumbles onto the remains of a broken ship. Something looks very odd about it. Rey looks around, the area looks familiar, she knows she has walked up this land before and has never seen this ship before. Rey pulls her staff out from behind her back and holds it up as she approaches, she knows she was just here the other day but just by looking at the ship it looks like it's been here for weeks.

Rey slides through a broken window to see what lays inside. She misses a step and falls down landing face first on the pilots seat. Rey jumps up acting like nothing had happened. She stands up standing her ground and holds her staff out in front. Rey expects someone to jump out, but nothing, only silence. Rey holds her guard for for a solid ten seconds before lowering her staff.

"Must be abandoned." Rey says.

Rey smirks knowing that she has struck gold around here somewhere, she jumps off the pilots sleet and wanders around the place to find something.

Rey wanders around and only finds dust and sand, just from looking around Rey can tell that whoever flew this crash landed hard. Sand was always everywhere as well as broken glass through the ship.

"What do we have here?" Rey smirks noticing something.

Rey walks over to what looks to be a broken safe, Rey smirks and grabs the edge of the door. She gives it a pull but it doesn't budge. Rey groans and gives it a hefty pull swinging the safe door open. Rey falls back on her ass. While she did just get sand in what feels like her ass she doesn't care as she managed to get the safe open. She runs over to it and jumps inside thinking she had just struck gold. She looks around the safe only to find it empty with what looks to be a broken but glowing shard.

"Must be worth at least something." Rey sighs.

She takes her bag off her back and slides it inside. Standing up she takes a quick sweep around the place with her eyes, with it being such a small ship theres nothing left to explore, even at her size she has seen everything already she needed and what she had just found was probably the most she would have found.

Rey climbs down the side of the ship landing on the hot sand. She stands up and readjusts herself before heading off. She doesn't have time to stop and rest at the moment or the place. Rey knows that if she is here for any longer someone will come along and see her. She takes a couple of steps form the ship when she hears something coming from behind. Rey's stomach turns, she's not quite able to make out what it is but knows that it's not good. She picks herself up and starts running as fast as she can without looking back. Rey only runs a couple of feet before tripping over a rock and landing face first in the stand.

"Stay back!" Rey shouts. She rolls over on her back and holds her staff out in front of her. She looks up and sees.....


1) A droid that looks like a ball, it beeps and looks down at the tiny woman scanning it. It's BB8
2) its a ugly alien creature smiling, it knows that Rey would be worth a fortune.
3) It's a alien mercenary wearing a fully body armour with a lot of guns and weapons at it's side
4) It's a giant alien lizard creature.
12432131.title: Minizora Rey

124321313.content:
"What do we have here?" came a partly synthesized voice "A minizora in this climate, hardy little bitch aren't you" they cooed as Rey gets a proper look at them.

Dressed in sleek and as always fairly androgynous armor, the colour scheme being an unfamiliar black and purple, with some kind of emblem in red on the shoulders. The visor was featureless, but high tech even to her eyes as the faceplate functioned almost like a screen, and the collapsible weaponry favored by high end mercenary tropes strapped to their back and hips, as well as odd protrusions on their shoulders.

Not wanting to be sold into slavery by whoever this person was Rey made a run for it, hoping to get herself lost in the deralict ship before she could be caught.

"Really?" the voice was a strange mix of tired and amused, before with a press of a few buttons on their gauntlet a glowing net shot out and ensnared the tiny, the electrical charge knocking the minizora out in seconds. Picking up the mini they noticed she was very well curved for a desert bug, definitely a keeper 'Boss says I can't have a pet, never said a minizoran sextoy wasn't allowed' they grin behind the visor

Rey comes to with a groan, paniced when she see's she in a cage, though at least she was still in her clothes and not restrained in any way besides the bars on her room. Peering through she could see the mercenary from before on a holocall

"Why am I not surprised Tals, you were bound to find one eventually. Just treat it well, even if it is just a toy"

The gesture clearly indicated an eyeroll "Like Sara and Nyssa aren't pole dancing with your cock everynight. Everything will be fine boss, besides, you of all people know how lonely the job can get"

There was a deep sigh "I know, which is why I just don't want you to break her, not anytime soon at least"

"Got it special K" there was a chuckles on both sides "See you soon"

The chair swivels and Rey is one more face to face with her abductor, then she hears he hiss of valves/seals being broken and the helmet is removed

"Hello little one" a lightly accented voice coos "My name is Tali, and you are my toy. Get used to it, you're not going anywhere, anytime soon" silver eyes flash possesively as Rey swallows. Lavender skin, short navy/raven hair, plump pouty lips and those large eyes, Rey didn't know this woman's species but they were clearly built for sex appeal. The new angle also gave her a full view of the symbol, an eye in a spiral... the emblem of the Demon Eye mercenary company, quite well known all throughout the known regions of space.

1) Tali gets to work on Rey quickly, putting her to use in her needy pussy and hungry ass once the ship's autopilot was stable
2) Rey tries to escape, with or without the force, annoying Tali when she catches her, the tiny now worried this was not going to be a pleasant experience ahead
3) Tali decides to see if Rey will be any use for the job, giving her a chance to avoid being JUST a sex toy to the giantess
124321313.title: An Alien Mercenary

choices: "No where at the moment, just enjoying my time off."
"The other side of the galaxy, I have a job to do."
"Going to go and drop off some shipments."
1243213132.content:
Rey sits back in the cage hugging her knees a little terrified, this is the first time since she could remember she has ever left the planet and been into space. Since her cage is placed next to the pilot's seat she could see everything out the front, all the starts zooming by and just marvelling into the empty space.

Rey looks over at the giant woman who her her attention focused on piloting. Rey slowly stands up and walks to the side of the cage. Rey just stares at the woman as she pilots. Rey whimpers a little bit as she had to admit that she is terrified. She has heard of the group Demon's Eye before and from the stories she has heard they can be ruthless. At first Rey just thought they were just a legend and a myth but now that she's in the hands of one she's scared for her own life.

Rey looks over at the lock for the cage, while it does look heavily locked she's seen those kind of locks before. She walks over to it and smirks a little. Despite the Demon's Eye being known for their brains and brawn Rey thought it was very dumb to put this kind of lock on a cage for a Minizora. Rey has been trapped in a cage like this before and her last escape was too easy. She slides her hand inside the lock and fiddles around. What made this lock useless for a Minizora is that the key hole is big enough for a tiny hand to slide inside and find the lock. Rey manages to turn the key lock slowly as possible until she hears a click.

"Demon Eye zero. Rey one." Rey giggles softly to herself as the door swings open.

Rey carefully and quietly climbs out of the cage. The ship jerks forward a little due to dodging what must have been a astroid Rey is thrown forward and falls down onto the mercenary's giant shoe with a thud. Rey rolls over and grabs her stomach as the steal toed foot hurt her landing.

"The hell?" Rey hears a voice form above.

She looks up to see Tali's giant silver eyes locked onto her tiny form, Rey's stomach turns, she knows that this is her last moments alive. Tali presses a few buttons on the control panel to set it to auto pilot. Rey whimpers unable to move due to her injury, Tali reaches down and curls her giant fingers around Rey's tiny form. Rey lets out a little whimper as she can feel her giant warm fingers against her skin though her rags. She is bought up to Tali's giant face with a look of disappointment.

"Where did you think you were going little one?" Tali asks.

"N-n-n-n-nowhere." Rey stutters.

Tali looks back at the cage and then shoots her attention back to Rey who is whimpering even more.

"Just calm down sweetheart." Tali says softly and gently strokes Rey's head. "I'm not going to hurt you, if you wanted out of the cage you should have just said something. it was the biggest cage I had sorry."

Rey's eyes widen not sure how to respond to that, she looks into Tali's large sliver eyes then down to her puffy lips. Rey still feels a bit shaken up just not sure what to do or what to say, she thought she was going to get the life crushed out of her but instead she's getting a soft talk from her captor. Tali's fingers trail over Rey's head and back gently massaging it. Rey blushes a little and bites her bottom lip, she had to admit that this is rather soothing and feels great. She closes her eye and does her best not to moan. She blushes more when she hears Tali giggle.

"So how did you get out of the cage?" Tali asks. "That lock is supposed to be super strong, nothing should have been able to get out."

"Um, it is." Rey blushes unsure if she should admit it to the giant creature. "But for Minizoras it's easy to pick the lock. Our hands are small enough to fit inside the locks to unpick it. It wasn't exactly hard."

"Super cute and super smart." Tali coos. "I made the right choice in you my pet. I could make good use of your skills as well."

"Thanks." Rey blushes. "Why did you take me?"

"Because you looked all alone out there." Tali explains. "I've actually seen you on Jakku for the past couple of years I've been there and you looked to be all alone and fragile. I thought I should give you a home as if you were out there any longer you could have been killed."

"I can take care of myself." Rey huffs. "I've managed to go years living on my own and surviving."

"I could tell," Tali laughs. "You looked so prepared and cleaver when I stumbled onto you, what was your plan again? Run and hope the giant woman doesn't step on me?"

"Shut up," Rey blushes and looks away.

Tali smirks and loses it, she finds the tiny woman in a grump absolutely adorable. This just makes Rey blush more as she is being laughed at by her captor.

"I could just eat you up." Tali smirks. "Where are my manners? What's your name sweetie?"

"Rey," She says softly.

"I like that name," Tali says softly. "My little pet Rey, it's got a nice ring to it don't you think?"

"I guess." Rey blushes.

The giant woman smiles softly and leans back in her chair and continues to pat Rey's head and back. Rey is just in shock at this point, she expected something horrible to happen, she was taken form her planet and locked up in a cage. She would have thought that escaping her cage and being caught would lead to severe punishment especially form a Demon's eye mercenary. What was more shocking was she got the complete opposite, a laid back and caring captor made even stranger by the fact that this was all coming from a Demon's eyes mercenary.

"Where are you heading?" Rey asks.
1243213132.title: Rey's Uncertain Fate

12432131322.content:
"Home, I've been on a job for 3 months, Jakku being my only reststop since I started. I miss my family, even Elsa" she mutters with a joking tone, remembering the necrofriggian that was basically the older sister/mother figure to a lot of the crew, and a pain in the ass for some for that exact reason.

"Oh, where are you from, is your home planet far from Jakku?" Rey asks curiously, seeing it may have been the wrong question.

"My home planet was destroyed during the time of the empire, but I hadn't seen it has home for a while before. My parents and sister were killed in a raid when I was a teenager, and I ran into Kaos, the Founder of the Demon Eye a month after escaping. He took me in, taught me a lot mostly about how to survive in this world. Over the years those asylum rejects and eccentrics, they've become my family, I've even helped recruit some promising hopefuls to the company" she sounded proud, Rey happy this woman had a family that cared about her, even if it made her sadder about her own home life.

She was soon distracted by the wicked looking and enormous spaceship that appeared out the front window of Tali's craft "that's amazing" she gasps

Tali chuckles "that's the Ouroboros, or as I call it, home" she sees a green light out the corner of her eye and smiles, a sign the IFF was accepted and she was clear to land once the hanger bay opened. Once the ship came to rest, a familiar, comforting voice came over the speakers

"Welcome home Tali Galvan dar Kaos"

"Hello Tardis" the merc replies with a soft smile before standing setting Rey on her shoulder "hang onto the imobolisation entanglement generator if you feel you're going to lose your balance" she recommends, Rey looking confused and wished she knew as it was clear she might need it as Tali swayed with each step.

"She means the shoulderpad looking device little one" the voice retrurns, Rey having grabbed it by the time Tali has properly boarded the larger ship

"Who was that?" Rey asks as Tali walks through the ship

"Technically she's a what, but she's the Boss's AI companion and pilot, she keeps the ship running and moves us when needed" she explains

"And the boss taught her sarcasm... somehow" Tali turns and grins, Rey nearly knocked off when she hugs a laughing Togruta with a mostly white face and dark head tails

"Of course he did, anything else of note?"

"Elsa's back from her latest hit, but nothing new Miss I stopped an assassination plot singlehandedly " the other girl teases, punching Talis armored forearm "I see you got yourself a mascot, can you be any more like Kaos but with tits?"

Tali rolls her eyes "Ash, shut up. This is Rey, she's my pet, but I think she might also be useful on the job, she escaped her cage without any gear or assistance from me" she explains, the Togruta surprised and a little impressed.

"Very nice, you have all the luck Tals" she coos, petting Rey before walking off.

What next?

1) Tali heads up to Kaos for debriefing, Rey surprised to see a reptid with a minzora clearly playing the part of PA, while another is curled up on his lap like a kitten
2) Tali didn't want to say it out loud, but she was worried about Rey's health having lived her tiny life on Jakku so has them both checked over by Dr. Unohana. All is fine, until she detects that Rey is Force Sensitive.
3) a rumble near her ear tells Tali her pet is hungry, so heads to the mess hall so they can both be fed
12432131322.title: "Home to see my family,"

124321313222.content:
"I need to get myself checked out at the medical bay, while I'm there I think you should get a check up too." Tali says.

"You don't have to." Rey says.

Tali ignores Rey and heads to the medical bay. Rey shivers and grabs a hold of Tali's shoulder armour, she's never been to a medical bay before but the idea of giant needless poking into her doesn't sound the best. Rey looks up at Tali with a little whimper, Tali's eyes were locked forward as she heads to the bay, he pace was faster than usual and something about her seems a little off.

Tali enters the medical bay and Rey's stomach drops as she sees what looks to be an older woman, she has dark eyes reasonably well endowed, graying hair in a bun and a scary smile. Rey swallows her tongue as she can tell that if you step out of line this woman will not be pleased.

"Afternoon Unohana." Tali smiles entering.

"You here for a check up?" Unohana says.

"Yes," Tali nods. "As well as one for my pet."

Unohana screws up her face and gets a closer look at Rey, Rey awkwardly smiles and gives her a little way as her grey eyes look over her body. Unohana sighs and snatches Rey off Tali's shoulder without warming. Rey screams as the giant bony fingers squeeze around her tight, Unohana drops Rey onto a small table that looks to be designed for tiny creatures like herself. Unohana pulls a small box over Rey's head that looks to be a hanging light in a way. Unohana presses a few button on the machine and lays Rey flat on the table.

"Stay still while the machine scans you." Unohana orders.

Rey nods nervously and lays there flat and with her head tilted to the side. As she gets scanned she watches Unohana check up on Tali, it doesn't take her munch as Tali gets a quick scan from a little light gun that scans her body.

"You're fine as always Tali." Unohana sighs.

"Thanks Unohana." Tali smiles. "Hows Rey?"

"Lets have a look shall we?" Unohana says.

Unohana stands up and looks over the screen that is scanning Rey. Unohana face screws up a little and hits the machine a little as it becomes a little unresponsive.

"You're pet is fine," Unohana says. "She's just mainly skin and bones with not much meet on her, a little force sensitive but this machine could be making that up, its been wrong before."

"Thanks Doc." Tali smiles.

Rey sits up as Unohana removes the scanner from above her. Tali reaches over and picks Rey up carefully before gently sitting her down on her open palm. Rey shakes a little as Tali sits down and her smile drops. Tali's fingers travel up and down Rey's body feeling her bony form against her fingers. Rey blushes a looks away a little as her fingers just graze her privet parts.

"You okay?" Rey asks meekly.

"I was going to ask you that." Tali says. "How long have you been living on Jakku?"

"As long as I can remember." Rey sighs. "My parents left me there when I was young and I grew up on my own. Fighting and scavenging for food wherever I could find."

"They never came back for you?" Tali asks.

Rey takes a deep breath doing her best to hold back her tears. Rey looks up and sees Tali's sad expression, her fingers rub her back in a soothing matter nearly breaking Rey. Rey whimpers and breaks into tears. She hugs her knees shielding herself from the giant woman. Rey feels Tali lift her up a little more, Rey is a little scared but it all drops as she feels a Tali's giant lips press against her head gently kissing her. Rey blushes a little and looks up at Tali who is smiling and has a few tears down her checks herself.

"As long as you are with me little one you will never be alone." Tali smiles softly. "You're my little girl now and I promise to always love and care for you."

"Thanks." Rey smiles with a blush.

"No problem beautiful." Tali whispers with a smile whipping a few tears from Rey's check with her finger.

Tali leans in and gives Rey another kiss but this time on her face. Her lips cover Rey's entire face as she gently kisses her. Rey smiles and blushes, she had never felt a caring kiss like that before in her life. Tali lowers Rey down to her chest and holds her close while gently rubbing her back with her fingers. Rey smiles and closes her eyes leaning into the fingers and holds herself against Tali's chest. Despite only knowing this woman for a hour or two Rey feels safe in Tali's hands. Everything Tali does feels genuine especially her feelings towards her.

Rey just smiles enjoying the feeling of Tali holding her.


What happens next?

1) Tali has to head off for a mission on the other side of the galaxy
2) Tali suggests they go and get something to eat.
3) Tali has to go and see her boss.
4) Tali heads off and meets up with some friends
124321313222.title: Rey's Scan

choices: Dealing with the no good Hutt clan
Special delivery for Luke and Mara
1243213132223.content:
Tali lightly sighs as she returns Rey to her shoulder "Now we've both gotten a mostly clean bill of health, probably a good time to check up on the boss and see if I have any new jobs that need doing" she explains to the mini junker before leaving the med bay. She smiles as whenever she peeks at Rey the young woman was looking at everything in the ship in awe, and everyone in surprise, they were an eclectic, some would even call 'diverse' group but they all got along in the end, even if some of them should have been put in a ward years back.

She almost made it to the Captain's office, when a familar voice purrs in her ears "Someone's eager to leave again are they?" Rey squeaks as a shawled being with gem like eyes phased through the floor to greet them "I only just hear you're back and you're nearly out the door again already"

"Hello Elsa" Tali gives a half smile, she loved the necrofriggian, but she always had been and still was a mother hen, ironic given she was the one most likely to leave a body-count during a mission, after the boss of course

"Hello Tali, and friend" she coos, Rey a little surprised to be acknowledged by what she now realized to be a kind of alien moth creature "Don't worry, I also have a new assignment in the Outer Rim, even have to bring Dementor and some of his toys along with me" the woman grimaces as much as her face allowed, she really hated data collection missions, because she was essentially babysitting morons, less so when they were also hired to do the data collection themselves but it was still really boring.

Tali nods, giving a sympathetic smile "Maybe you'll get attacked by pirates, or Scottish loan sharks on the way home" she suggests, the older woman's shoulders shake in a low chuckle

"I can only hope. Goodbye dearies" she waves and leaves, ghosting through the floor once more

"Well, that sets the tone for this meeting I suppose" Tali hums, walking up to the door, which opens silently, hense why the previous conversation was still going

"I still think this Snoak guy is bad news, not to mention creepy as fuck" the minizoran woman on the table complains, a wall of screens in front of her, dual omnitools on her arms allowing her to interact with them

"That's why we funnel all his jobs to Elsa, and charge him double the usual rate. Killing something semi intangible is very fucking hard" a much older voice croaks, then cackles "Either way, we have eyes on the wrinkled fuck and if worst comes to worst I'll deal with it personally" (Anyone who has watched Power Rangers, Kaos sounds like Mesagog, because lizard demon man)

"Tali is back" the mini notes from behind her screens, Rey now seeing she had lightly tanned skin, a nice figure, which her dress hugged and showed off nicely, her hair loose and to her shoulder blades.

The chair rotates and a red eyed, black scaled reptid grins, showing off razor sharp teeth "Tali, and her pet. Nice to see you're back and in one piece. Retsu has already sent me the medical scans, you're fine as usual and a force sensitive mini, very strange, but also, interesting" he coos

ZZZ purr ZZZ purr

Rey turned her head when she hears Tali mutter "I knew she was a fucking neko" the louder "Do you have some more work for me boss, or are the girls distracting you again?" she teases

"Nyssa is a complete professional, no office hour shenanigans occur" Kaos assures "Sara, well she is a former sex slave and likes the job, so yes she can be distracting when she's in the mood. Her sleeping is a good sign my dear, it means no nightmares, and no quirks making themselves known" he then turns to the other mini "Nys, the files"

"Of course Sir" she nods, then with a few gestures 3 larger holoscreens appear in front of the mercenary

"As you can see you have some interesting choices: Bodyguard duty in the heart of the republic, for Ms Solo and her family. Pest control in the Outer Rim, the Hutts are back and think we've left, why don't you give them a shock? And finally, we have a very interesting delivery for a Miss Mara Jade-Skywalker, Saber crystals, difficult to find these days, and a good energy source so keep the weapons systems unbugged in case of pirates dumb enough to try rob you" Kaos explains, Tali clicks her tongue as she considers the options

Which will it be?
