1243231.content:
Consciousness came slowly to Marty and his memories even slower. As he awoke, he remembered what happened, Doc Brown and his time machine. He had always been close with the Doc, he never looked down on him because he was a minizora and was always eager to show him his latest inventions. What he had to show Marty was a time machine built into a DeLorean, a minizora sized DeLorean. It was a prototype of the version he was building for himself and he thought Marty could try it out. He thought that if the first man back in time was a minizora it would show the world the importance of little guys.

Marty was only supposed to travel back and forth in time, Doc selecting the year 1955 because that’s where the idea for time travel first came to him. So, Marty shot off, disappearing into the past. As soon as he arrived, whatever was powering the car stopped working and he was stranded decades in the past.

Trying not to panic, Marty went into town to explore, his desire to see the past pushing away his worries about being stuck in the past or in danger of the giant people around him. Hiding the DeLorean, he met of all people his father or the teenager that would become his father. It was an odd experience, seeing his old man as a young man, seeing how easily he was pushed around. Marty thought he was easy to victimize because of his size but he had nothing on George McFly. Still, they got along well, and Marty enjoyed getting to know his dad in the past.

Everything came to a literal screeching halt when George was nearly hit by a car. Marty saw the car coming and tried to get his dad out of the way, nearly resorting to biting his ankle. He saved George but ended up nearly getting hit and went flying. His head ached a bit, but he felt fine overall. Thank God for the extra toughness that comes with being a minizora. Now, where was he?

“It’s okay, don’t try to move. You had a nasty fall,” a warm, sweet voice said to Marty. Recognizing the voice as his mother, Marty didn’t move, just grabbed the sheet covering him and letting out a loud groan. Was everything a dream after all? Had he just imagined the whole time-traveling experience after taking some bad hit? It seemed likely as he felt a soft finger stroking his side. His mom always did that for him when he was hurt when he was little.

“I had this crazy dream, mom,” Marty muttered, stirring slightly and pushing the finger away, not wanting to be cuddled. His mother was always smothering him with affection, it got annoying sometimes.

“Don’t worry about that right now. I’ll look after you and make sure your safe, little man.” Marty couldn’t place it, but something was very off. Deciding that he had to see what was going on, Marty sat up and cracked his eyes open. Hovering over him was the brightly smiling much, much younger face of his mother. Marty just stared at the teenage girl, her face looming so close that her hot breath blew out onto him.

“It’s okay. I’m not going to hurt you. I’m Lorraine. I saw you get hurt trying to save George and I brought you home with me to get better. You’re safe,” Lorraine said, leaning her head in even further as she peered down at Marty with excitement. She had him on her desk in her bedroom and had been watching him sleep, looking at his tiny body under the thin sheet. She had been so utterly fascinated with the tiny boy that she had been like this for hours, just looking at him.

“Ma…I mean, thank you very much,” Marty said nervously. His mom’s eyes were fixated on him in a way that made him slightly uncomfortable. It reminded him too much of the look his girlfriend gave him before they found a quiet place to make out at.

“You’re very welcome,” Lorraine beamed, pleased by the tiny man’s gratitude. “I’ve always heard about minizora people, but I’ve never seen one before. You're very special.”

“Thanks, my mom says that all the time to me,” Marty awkwardly told her. He tried to get up and maybe move away from the giant face above him but when he pulled away the cloth, he discovered he was just in his briefs. He swiftly covered himself back up, blushing harder than he could ever remember blushing before.

“Your clothing was dirty, so I washed them. They should be dry soon,” Lorraine said, fibbing just a little. She had washed his clothes, but they had dried a long time ago. She just wanted to keep this little guy around in his undies a bit longer. She wanted to know more, like his name. She’d tried checking his underwear, but she couldn’t make out his name.

“Great, great, great,” Marty said, wishing that he had gone to the future instead of the past right now. Alone with his clueless, teenage mom, things couldn’t get more awkward.

13111111.content:
Byleth groans as he pulls himself from sleep, it was the same dream as before: a dark, cavern like structure, the only thing of note being an ornate throne, or chair given the eccentricity of some nobles, as seen during his mercenary work.

Speaking of "you up kid" bellowed Byleths father Gerelt, a grizzled knight, who still took good care of his minizora son after his wife's mysterious death shortly after his birth. He'd spent those years as a mercenary, and despite his size, his boy took to the job like a dragon to the sky, helped by an enchanted cloak he'd paid a dark mage to make for him.

"Yes father" Byleth greets with a nod, as always trying to show his independence despite his condition.

"Good, we got work to do, jobs are plenty in our line of work" he chuckles as Byleth smirks slightly and hopes onto the older man's shoulder, ready to go.

Later

"Where did all these bandits come from?" Dimitri wonders aloud, his lance only able to do so much

"Hell if I know, there's freaking everywhere to though" Claude shrugs before notching and firing another arrow into someone's shoulder

"Might be more helpful to actually take them out of the fight" Edelgard grouses as her axe takes the head off one of her opponents, though overreaching lead to her nearly joining them on the ground... where it not for some kind of blur zooming past her ear, slamming into the man's skull hard enough not only to pierce the eye, but go all the way and stab the brain, before practically flickering around and taken out a half dozen more.

'What in the world?' The future emperor wonders, before feeling a minor tug on a loose bang of her hair, as well as soft boots landing on her nose. Crossing her eyes she sees an adorably tiny young man holding her hair like a rope and standing delicately on the tip of her nose

"Hello Miss, sorry about the intrusion but you looked like you needed a little help" he says politely, looking into her pale purple eyes curiously

"You're a mini, how did you fight like that? How are you even face high?" The girl asks,trying not to knock him off her face, though has hands cupped beneath just in case

"Something small zipping around is hard to hit, reversed at my size even a knights visor is a reasonable target for my blade. As for the flying itself, I have a cloak with an enchantment that enables me to float around"

Edelgard whistles "impress...urk" she grunts as a hand axe gets her in the back, stabbing her through the heart and sending both her and Byleth falling, the white haired girl about to flatten him with her rather impressive bosom when...

"Killed by tits, and accidentally at that. Not very impressive" an amused young voice titters, and Byleth opens his eyes, gulping when Edelgards house sized bust hovered inches from his prone form. Then the image blurs and he was once more in his dream, but not alone thb is time, there was a green haired girl sitting on the throne, looking at him curiously. "Well, that was quite a waste of life, needless too" she sighs deeply " of course, we could change that"

"What do you want?" Byleth asks, knowing how these things work

"Come play with me in here sometimes, it's boring in here" she coos, and Byleth can't think of a reason to deny her "great, I'll rewind time, you just need to save the girl hero" she teases, then like a movie everything rewinds back to his conversation with Edelgard

"Hold that thought " he says calmly before throwing himself over the girl's head, shooting off and burying his sword in the assassins brain stem, tearing through it before returning to her shoulder this time, just as his father arrives in the other direction to the Seiros guards.

Next day

Byleth couldn't believe what had happened in less than 24 hours, the conversation with the 3 royals, from the safety of Edelgards shoulder was actually nice and pretty normal, it was meeting the Archbishop, who while trying to be nice gave him really creepy vibes, and then being offered a teaching position at the monastery that sent his mind for a loop. Add to that he had to pick a class of 9 to play caretaker for, despite being a size he could be easily ignored and crushed as well as toyed with. Still he chose it, and was now the "_____" kids Professor.

What House?

1311111111.title: Edelgard's roomate

1311111112.content:
Edelgard brought Byleth to a large room, clearly not designed for one of his stature. Byleth assumed it was another student that Edlegard was introducing him to, but that notion was banished the next second when Edelgard opened the door and inside was nothing to indicate a student lived there. This notion was banished even further when Edelgard started talking.

"This is your room, my teacher."

"You guys don't have any Minizora rooms?" , asked Byleth, his head turned up as he repositioned himself in the queen-sized bed that was Edelgards cleavage to look towards her face.

"Unfortunately, no. I did proposition that you stay in my room but the Archbishop denied that option quite vehemently, almost as if she didn't trust me to care for you. The best I could do is give you your own room, rather than forcing you to stay with someone you don't like, and someone that would take my teacher away from me."

Byleth, despite being so nearby he only faintly heard the last part, although what she said was completely undecipherable due to the quiet volume. Byleth let the topic drop, dismissing it as unimportant or just an afterthought.

"I will leave you to get acquainted with your room, my teacher. Be sure to call me if you need anything!"

And with that, Edelgard picked Byleth out of her bosom and put him on the desk. She then left the room and closed it behind her, leaving Byleth to stare at her ass that she was intentionally waving at him. The thing that shook him out of his trance was the shrill voice of a girl he had heard many times before, the one who had called herself Sothis.

"Are you going to stare all day at something that is no longer there?"

Byleth shook his head, face red with embarrassment.

"Although I certainly agree she is quite attractive, do not forget what you are doing here. You are a teacher, someone who is not allowed to romance his students! I believe the Archbishop made that quite clear when she talked to you about your duties and responsibilities.

At long last Byleth turned around to look at Sothis. She, like everyone else around Byleth, was a giant. She stood at 4'5, a rather small size but to Byleth, she was still ginormous. In comparison to Edelgard, who was 5'2, Sothis stood more than half a foot smaller then Edelgard.

The first thing Byleth noticed that he somehow never noticed before, was that Sothis was barefoot. If he were taller then her, he wouldn't even notice up close but at his diminutive size, her feet were very noticeable, The next thing he thought about was her dress. She wore it all the times he had seen her before, but never while she was standing up. The biggest difference, however, was the sash that covered her panties while she sat. It would still block perving eyes from people of normal size, it did nothing to obstruct Byleth's view of her black bland designed panties.

As if just noticing where Byleth's eyes were, Sothis scoffed."You have nothing better to do than stare at my undergarments?"

Once again, Byleth blushed and looked away as Sothis let out a chuckle. "You are so easily embarrassed. It is quite adorable, actually.".

Byleth spent the rest of the day going around his room and making tunnels and escape rooms. Living his life as a Minizora had taught him many things, one of which was to use his size to his advantage and another was to never be completely off his guard.

Nightfall came in what felt like an instant and Byleth jumped up to the bed made for a person 15 times his size. He made his resting place on the pillow and let himself drift to sleep, thinking of the many experiences that had happened in such a short time, as well as thinking about what the future may hold.

When he awoke...

A: Edelgard was knocking at his door. It was time to introduce him to the rest of the class!
B: Edelgard had snuck into his room in the middle of the night and was snuggling with him.
C: Bernie was knocking on the door in the middle of the night, having come to apologize for her grabbing and throwing of him.

1311211113.content:
Edelgard took the minizora on a brief tour around the monastery, showing her the cathedral, the mess hall, the gardens, and of course the dormitories. Most of the time, Bernadetta was wishing that the future empress would end the tour, but instead she was shown off like some sort of prize. Most of the students had something or other to say.

"Oh, you're the new student? Well it's very nice to meet you! Can I call you Bern?" asked Dorothea.

"You are being Bernadetta? It is good to be making your acquaintance," said Petra.

Hubert didn't say anything. He just let out a sinister chuckle and walked away.

"Oh wow, a minizora! And a noble, too! Awesome!" said Caspar. He tried to fist bump her. Bernadetta nearly fainted as she thought he was going to punch her.

"I heard we were getting a new student--though I didn't realize you'd be a minizora. Edelgard, did you conceal this information from me deliberately?" Ferdinand accused.

She didn't get introduced to Linhardt. Edelgard couldn't find him. "He's probably asleep," the house leader explained.

Edelgard even took her to meet the members of the other houses--first the Blue Lions.

"Your new house member, Edelgard? Why is she cowering like that?" Dimitri asked, some concern--and perhaps a slight accusation--in his voice.

Dedue didn't speak, but offered a finger for the minizora to shake. Bernadetta was too terrified to touch the finger, so Edelgard apologized on her behalf and moved on.

"Hi there! What sort of things do you like to eat? I want to make you a nice treat to welcome you!" Annette offered.

Ashe and Ingrid were having a conversation in the library when Edelgard found them, but they both welcomed Bernadetta to the monastery with warm greetings.

"Oh, it's delightful to meet you, Bernadetta! I hope we can be the best of friends," said Mercedes.

"I don't care. If she isn't able to spar with me she's a waste of my time," said Felix.

"Oh, wow, you're pretty cute! Do you want to go out sometime?" Sylvain asked, predictably. Edelgard might have slapped him if her hands weren't full.

Finally she took her around to the Golden Deer, offering a brief warning about Claude being... "unpredictable"

"Your new house member's looking a bit short there, Edelgard. You sure you'll be ready for the Battle of the Eagle and Lion? Not too late to give her to the Golden Deer, we could use a tiny spy," Claude offered.

"Wow, you're adorable! I should make you something, like, an accessory or something!" Hilda said.

"It doesn't matter if you're small. Put in hard work and you'll get results," Leonie advised.

"H-hey, is she okay?" Raphael asked, after Bernie turned sheet white at the sight of him. Something about his size and muscles was heavily intimidating.

"Pleased to meet you... Are... you going to stop cowering? I'd like to shake your hand," Ignatz inquired.

"You're a noble? I hope you're ready to live up to the high expectations of your blood," Lorenz stated.

"Finally, I'm not the smallest student anymore," Lysithea sighed with relief. Maybe with someone so much smaller, she'd seem older by comparison.

Finally, when introduced to Marianne, no words were spoken. Both girls were too terrified or anxious to speak, and after a few seconds Marianne stammered an excuse and ran off. "We could get along," Bernadetta thought to herself.

Finally the tour was over. "You'll have a roommate. It's unconventional, but Lady Rhea felt it was best if you weren't all on your own, for safety reasons."

Who will be your roommate? Will it be Dorothea, the popular, flirtatious songstress? Or maybe Petra, the foreign princess? Or does Rhea think it would be best if someone outside her own house kept an eye on her?

13112111132.content:
"You may remember Petra. She's the foreign girl with the marking below her right eye who has a bit of trouble with our language," Edelgard said.

"Y-yeah?"

"You'll be staying with her for the time being. As time goes on you may move around rooms. There were... many volunteers to be your roommate. Sylvain alone submitted twenty-seven requests."

"I-is that allowed?"

"No," Edelgard said firmly as she opened the door to the dorm. It was a room much like, well, any other room in the monastery. Petra was sitting on the edge of her bed, restringing a bow. She's an archer too? Bernadetta thought to herself.

"Petra, is everything set up for Bernadetta?" Edelgard asked. Petra nodded.

"Yes. I was making sure that she would be finding her arrangements comforting," Petra said, jutting her chin towards her desk. There, on the surface of the desk, was a small set of furniture--a bed, a desk, and a chair--just the right size for her tiny roommate. A ladder provided access from the floor up to Bernadetta's living area.

"I-it's awfully... exposed... Couldn't my bed be in... a closet, or a drawer, or something?" Bernadetta asked.

"Why are you wanting to be hidden?"

"I, uh, don't really like social contact."

"I'll leave you to get acquainted. Lessons start in two days, don't be late," Edelgard said, setting Bernadetta down on Petra's desk before leaving, shutting the door behind her.

For a while, no words were said. Petra continued to string her bow. Bernadetta hid behind the bed, watching Petra anxiously. Suddenly, Petra looked up at her, and Bernie's head immediately disappeared behind the bed. After a brief moment she looked down again, and Bernadetta peeked out again. Then she did it again, suddenly shooting a glance in the minizora's direction, the messy purple hair disappearing instantly again.

"You are reminding me of prey," Petra said.

"Wh-what?" Bernadetta asked, mortified.

"Yes. Like a rabbit in the tall grass. Always watching for enemies, and you flee at any sign of danger."

"Y-you're going to hunt me?"

"I am saying you are having traits in common with prey. You hold a bow but you are not being a hunter. Prey is seeing something strange and thinking of it as a foe. A hunter is seeing something strange and thinking of it as food."

"F-food? You think of me as food?" Bernadetta asked, turning pale. Petra fixed her eyes on the minizora, and said...

She finished stringing her bow, slung it over her shoulder, and grabbed Bernadetta in one hand with ease. Bernadetta, for her part, started screaming. Practically non-stop. It was a wonder she could fit enough air into her tiny lungs to scream like that, but she never seemed to inhale. Petra stuffed the minizora in her bag to stem the noise. The screaming was muffled to a dull hum, like that of a bee.

The entire way to the forest, Petra counted the number of times that Bernadetta stopped screaming. The total was four times, brief pauses to gasp for breath before resuming again. That was impressive on its own, Petra thought. She could be a fantastic swimmer.

Petra took Bernadetta out of her bag and set her on the ground. Bernadetta was still screaming, and upon being set down, she started to run.

"You should be making yourself quiet," Petra advised. "You will not be catching the prey while making such noises."

Bernadetta stopped screaming and cowered in the grass.

"C-catching prey?"

"Yes. You are being armed like a hunter, but acting like prey. I am wanting to find which one you are being. So I will be giving you the test. If you are managing to kill anything at least as large as a rabbit, you are being a hunter. You are having until the sun is vanished. After that, you are being prey, and I will be showing you how a hunter is hunting," Petra explained. The sun was high overhead now--noon. At this time of year, there were about six hours left before dusk fell and the sun disappeared.

"H-how am I supposed to kill anything? A rabbit is, like, ten times my size!" Bernadetta protested.

"You should be hunting prey, not making the questions. The time is passing," Petra said. With that she jumped up and, with extraordinary acrobatic ability, scaled a large tree in only a few seconds.

"You've done it now, Bernie..." Bernadetta mumbled to herself. She examined the bow in her hand. "Destiny, huh? I think it's my destiny to be totally screwed..." she said. She drew the bow back to test its draw weight. It was pretty heavy, proportionally. It took most of the tiny archer's strength to draw it back. She took aim at a tree trunk and released. The arrow hissed through the air, striking the tree with an extraordinarily loud "CRACK!"

Bernadetta flinched from the noise, and looked away. When she looked up, she was astonished to see a huge section of missing bark. The tree's bark must have been at least an inch thick--how powerful was that bow? Did she have a chance at this after all?

Unfortunately, the impact of the arrow would have scared away any nearby wildlife. Bernadetta took a deep breath, reassured herself--"You got this, Bernie..."--and ran off into the forest, searching for some animal that might just save her.

How does her hunt go?
131121111323.title: Hunt or be hunted

choices: Keep following Petra and Bernie for the next day.
Move on to the first lessons
Skip ahead to the mock battle
1311211113231.content:
The miniature archer considered her position carefully. She looked at the spot where the arrow had hit the tree. That was a lot of damage--Destiny was at least as powerful as a normal-sized bow. She had originally been thinking about where she could find a rabbit, but now she was starting to reconsider. A rabbit would be alert to smaller creatures. Any sort of wildfowl of sufficient size that she could find in these woods would be liable to eat her like they would a mouse. What she needed was an herbivore for sure, and one large enough to not notice her. She could think of only one option.

"Find a deer, Bernie," she whispered to herself, the words stated aloud making an impression in her memory. With that she hurried off into the woods.

Being small, she couldn't cover ground very quickly, but she was less likely to spook the wildlife. After about an hour, she found what she had been hoping to find: a rough path of snapped twigs and worn-down grass, with distinct hoof prints in the mud. A deer path. She took off running down the path, eyes fixed ahead.

The path took her further from her starting point than she had expected. Eventually she ran out of stamina and switched to walking at a swift pace. After an hour, she stopped and drank some rainwater that had collected in a leaf near the path. It was clear, fresh water that left her feeling revitalized.

It was about four in the afternoon when she spotted her target. It was a doe, moderately sized, eating grass in a clearing. It hadn't noticed her, thank goodness. But Bernadetta hesitated.

"Just aim carefully, Bernie. Make the shot count. One arrow, and... it's dead. Just like that. Doesn't Ms. Deer have a right to life too? Why should it have to die?" she thought to herself. She was frozen, arrow on the bowstring but the bow not drawn. Then Petra's words echoed in her head.

"Prey is seeing something strange and thinking of it as a foe. A hunter is seeing something strange and thinking of it as food."

Petra was right. Bernie knew she could never do this if she thought of the deer as a foe, or an animal. But if it was food... then taking its life was no more cruel than picking a carrot. With new resolve, Bernadetta aimed, drew, and fired her bow in a single, fluid motion.

Hissss...THWACK!

The arrow struck the deer in the middle of the torso, sending it sprawling. Bernadetta wasn't sure if it was dead yet, so she aimed and fired again, hitting it solidly in the belly with another powerful, solid "THWACK!"

It was done. The deer was lying totally still in the middle of the clearing. As the archer approached her kill, Petra emerged from the woods, grinning broadly.

"You are having done well, huntress!" she complimented, approaching Bernadetta. The minizora aimed her bow at the huge girl on instinct.

"St-stay back!"

"Have calmness, Bernie. I will not be hurting you," Petra said calmly, raising her empty hands. Bernadetta relaxed, lowering the bow.

"May I be carrying you?" Petra asked. Bernadetta nodded, and Petra carefully picked up the archer and placed her on her left shoulder.

"Your aim is being excellent. I was watching, and seeing as you had hesitation, but your arrows were flying true."

"Y-you don't really mean that," Bernadetta said. She wasn't at all accustomed to receiving legitimate compliments.

"I am meaning it fully," Petra reassured as she approached the deer body. She drew a knife and started to butcher it.

There was a special at the dining hall that day: venison skewers.
1311211113231.title: Bernie the huntress

choices: She spits Bernie out. "You are tasting of dirt and moss"
1311211113233.content:
Bernadetta ran through the forest, searching for any sort of animal. "Bigger than a rabbit" was a pretty limiting factor. She couldn't hunt a mouse, or a squirrel, or most birds. She needed something pretty big. Obviously a rabbit would work. Maybe a deer? A pheasant? Was a pheasant bigger than a rabbit? She decided to try to find a rabbit.

Her luck was very poor. Maybe she wasn't being quiet enough. Maybe rabbits didn't live in this part of the forest. Either way, soon she was exhausted from hurrying through the woods.

Finally, just as the sun was beginning to dip below the horizon, she spotted a large, brown hare. "This is it, Bernie, nice and easy," she mumbled. Unfortunately, that noise caught the rabbit's attention, and the huge mammal locked its eyes on her. That was enough to make her fall silent. She drew back the bow and considered the rabbit. The rabbit was her enemy. She had to win, or she'd be the one getting hunted. Would it stay still? Would it dodge? It could see her. It would consider her an enemy too. So it would dodge, right? That meant that she should aim a bit off from it. But which way would it dodge? She pointed her bow in front of it, then behind it, then--

Whissh--BAM! Her fingers slipped, and the arrow flew forth, sailing swiftly through the air and smashing into a rock, blasting away a circle of moss. The sound caused the rabbit to flee, and Bernadetta could even hear birds cawing overhead as they fled.

"No! Come back, Mr. Rabbit!" Bernadetta cried out. It was too late, the rabbit was gone. And the sun was gone too. She was out of time.

"Well, if I'm prey now, I'm going to act the part. I'll hide away until Petra forgets all about me," Bernadetta reasoned. She found a rock that she could just squeeze under, and she crawled beneath, waiting.

Minutes turned to hours. It was pitch black out, and the noises of the forest at night were starting to get to the minizora archer. A howl pierced through the night. Were there wolves? Would they smell her and get her even in her hiding place? But if they could smell her, was there anywhere she could hide? Bernadetta curled up in her hiding spot, shaking, terrified. She didn't sleep that night.

When the sun rose again, Bernadetta poked her head out. Morning dew covered the grass, and she drank it, the clear, fresh water revitalizing her somewhat. Suddenly--WHAM! Something hit her in the chest with incredible force, sending her flying. She landed on a fallen leaf, clutching her chest and groaning. She looked up, and saw Petra standing over her, putting an unusual arrow with a blunt weight on the end into her quiver. That must have been what hit her. Petra shot her!

"You are being out of time, little prey," Petra stated.

"N-no! Please!" Bernadetta begged as Petra leaned over and grabbed her between two fingers.

"You were not being a hunter. And that means you are being prey."

"L-let... me go..." the minizora pleaded.

"I was not having sleep this night. I could not be abandoning my search. I am being very hungry now. I will not be releasing the prey," Petra said. She opened her mouth wide and placed Bernadetta on her tongue, the tiny archer still reeling in pain from the arrow.

"N-no..." Bernadetta gasped as she tried to crawl to freedom, her clothes becoming soaked with saliva.

What does Petra do?
1311211113233.title: Time's up!

choices: Near the end of her journey through Petra
13112111132332.content:
With a horrible "CLACK!" the princess' teeth clamped shut, sealing Bernie in darkness. The tongue began to roll the poor girl around, drenching her in drool and getting a good taste of her. Bernadetta wondered, somewhere unconsciously, what she tasted like, though that was overshadowed by all her unyielding terror. The minizora squirmed indignantly, trying to ward off the giantess' tongue. Then, with a careful flick, the archer was tossed to the back of Petra's mouth, and with an echoing "GLK!" she was swallowed.

The girl's throat squeezed over Bernadetta, nudging her down, bit by bit, squelching as it pulled her into Petra's body. Bernadetta kept wriggling, trying to claw her way to freedom, but not even slowing things down. Finally, she was deposited into a hot, fleshy chamber, with wrinkled walls that dripped with a foul smelling liquid.

"N-no! I don't want..." Bernadetta stammered as she tried to press against the walls, which trembled and repelled her, knocking her down. In fact, the whole belly was undulating and churning, preventing her from staying steady.

"You were tasting delicious, Bernadetta," Petra complimented, her voice coming from all sides, booming around her minizora meal.

As a minizora, Bernadetta was immune to acids, but her clothes were not, and the princess' belly was keen to remind her of that fact. Within minutes her outfit was starting to wear out, and after only about half an hour holes started to appear. Within two hours all that was left of Bernadetta's tiny uniform was a few patches of cloth floating in Petra's belly.

The constant movement taxed Bernadetta significantly. The battering wore here out, and the heat made her sleepy. She didn't remember when it happened, but eventually she passed out, totally exhausted, into a deep sleep.

Where did Bernadetta wake up?

Bernadetta woke up, cold and disoriented. She felt... off. Had she been kidnapped again? Getting kidnapped two days in a row had to be some sort of record. She rubbed her head, and found that her hair was wet, soaked with cold water. Blinking and looking around, she saw one of the dormitories at Garreg Mach, and then turning her head she saw Petra looking down at her.

Bernadetta, predictably, started screaming.

"Be relaxing, Bernadetta. I will not be hurting you," Petra said in a soothing voice

"Y-you ate me!" the minizora protested. Petra nodded.

"That was being a poor decision. I am making the apologies. You are being as nature intended: small, defenseless, and I was taking advantage. Now I am thinking that not everything is matters of the hunter and the prey." Bernadetta blinked up at the princess, only now realizing that she was totally naked. She yelped and covered her private regions.

"I was not dressing you. My fingers are being too large for your clothing," Petra explained, setting Bernadetta down on the tiny bed. Her clothes were stashed in a set of drawers next to her desk that she hadn't previously noticed, but for the moment, she just grabbed a blanked to cover herself.

"S-so what now? A-are you going to eat me again?" Bernadetta asked.

"No. I am thinking that I should be protecting you. We should be friendly."

"You want to be friends? After you just ate me?"

"I was also letting you go..." Petra added, though she did seem somewhat sheepish. Bernadetta thought it over.

"Think, Bernie... If I'm her roommate, it'll be really bad if she's an enemy. I could ask for a new room assignment, but what if that made Petra mad? I can't just avoid her forever..." she considered silently. Finally, the minizora nodded.

"A-alright, let's be friends!" she called. Petra gave a warm smile.

"I have gratitude. Oh!" Petra exclaimed, setting a small object next to Bernadetta. It was her bow, Destiny.

"I was finding this on the ground after I..." Petra trailed off. Bernadetta hadn't even been thinking about her possessions, but the return of her bow was an unexpected comfort.

"Th-thanks!" Bernadetta exclaimed.

1)To Rickens normal friends, Lissa who the mage was sure conspire with Panne to find new ways to embarrass him, and Maribelle, another noble he's known his entire life and not as rude as she appears, she also has one hell of an ass only beaten in Rickens opinion by Pannes massive bunny buns.
2) His minizora friends: Gaius and Robin, the latter having the oddest introduction to Panne, being her 'boobytrapping' him and then releasing him in front of Ricken telling him she likes this one and can she keep it as a pet/love slave like he does her. Luckily for Robin he was used to it, having many similar moments with his girlfriend (Tharja), so laughed it off while Ricken looked about ready to have a heart attack.
131323213.title: The Taguel's master

13132322.content:
Ricken sighs as Chrom assigned him to the strategic division, he knew he couldn't be in the front line, but couldn't he at least be support? The trek to Grand-master strategist Robin's tent was enough of a hassle, never mind the fact he wasn't really sure how much use he could be when they already had someone like her directing the troops.

Still he cautiously entered the tent, seeing Robin working on their maps, her thick cloak for once missing from her shoulders, exposing a rather curvy figure as the minizora is almost hypnotized by the absentminded hip swaying. If anyone asks, it was the reason he was able to be grabbed and picked up without even knowing there were more than just the 2 of them in the room.

"It seems the little one has arrived my dear" the sorceress Tharja purrs, pressing herself into Robin's back as she drops the mini onto the board in front of the snow haired woman "He's quite a cute one indeed"

"He was chosen for his brains, not his other positives" Robin states, not reacting to the other Plegian's rather aggressive squeezing of her expansive chest "Ricken right?" she asks, him noticing her eyes dilate when Tharja nibbles on her neck

"Um, yes, but why did you want me when you're doing fine by yourself?" Ricken asks curious himself

"I like to get different perspectives on my plans, yours would be particularly helpful, given it's a more accurate battlefield view. Also ignore her, she has no concept of privacy, or correct time" Robin rolls her eyes, then squeaks as Tharja bites down on her shoulder

"Don't act like you don't love it" Tharja pouts, to which Robin slips her fingers under her chin, and turns her head for a kiss

"True. Also while we're on the subject, there is another reason we chose you little Ricken"

1) Given the number of her figurines that have made their way to her bed as well as inside herself and Tharja, Robin is well aware of her fetish, and so is very eager to have an actual person that small for her to control and fuck, alongside her lover.
2) Robin wants a baby, Tharja is mostly indifferent to the idea, but will do so to make Robin happy. Ricken was chosen besides his size, but due to her Plegian upbringing Tharja doesn't see him as a threat to Robin's heart, so is willing to let him be inside both of them and even impregnate the 2 sexy mages.
3) Robin wants a child to Tharja refuses to allow a man of any kind to touch her beloved, and Robin being equally possessive about a man putting himself in her dark mage. At a stalemate, Tharja suggests a substitute, given his size Ricken will always be essentially a child, just the kind of thing Robin would like, a baby who will never grow up and leave her.

1323211.content:
Alright, here's a premise to work with:
Despite his incredibly small stature, the 2-inch tall Minizora known as Link turned out to be the Chosen Hero to wield the Master Sword. So much so it shrank to fit him the moment he touched it. To his credit, he has more stamina than someone his size should, and is surprisingly capable at doing things. He is appointed to serve as Princess Zelda's personal knight/guard...but also to act as a small companion for the studious blonde that completely towers over him.

Alternatively, there is a link (heh) to more options.
1323211.title: Before the Calamity

1323212.content:
More options, sorry!

1) Link has just defeated Calamity Ganon...somehow, and now finds himself facing the comparatively huge Princess Zelda...
2) Other choices, likely gateways to other characters
1323212.title: After the Calamity

choices: The Hero's reward...given by the princess
13232121.content:
Link sighed as his breaths started to calm down. He had done it! Somehow! Against all odds he, a 2 inch tall Minizora had defeated Calamity Ganon once and for all! Then again, the powers gifted by the Goddesses did most of the work...but he was still the one who made the actual blows. Either way, here he was, barely taller than the long blades of grass all around him when he heard and felt a familiar sensation.

Boom, Boom, Boom

The quakes were rhythmic and shook the world around the puny hero. He knew exactly what is was...footsteps. And he knew exactly who they belonged to. Soon enough he found himself in a shadow with a familiar shape, and not soon after he heard a familiar, booming, yet feminine and gentle voice.

"Well hello down there, little Link.~"

He turned around and saw two brown boots towering above him. He barely reached the ankle of the massive being. Looking up, the boots turned into tight, black pants before giving way to the blue/white-shirt. Eventually his eyes settled on the beautiful face of Princess Zelda, who didn't look a day older than she had been 100 years ago. Her blue eyes watched him curiously, a smile on her face as she looked down at the Minizora at her feet.

"You done staring? Yes, it's really me, I swear! It's amazing what you just did...you saved Hyrule...and you're a Minizora! Not that I ever doubted you of course....But still, seeing you down there in front of my boots. I can only be impressed."

Link didn't say anything. Not only would his words be drowned out by Zelda's much louder voice, but he was also staring up at her in awe. he had regained most of his memories involving her...but this was the first time in a century he was looking up at the Princess' stunning frame. Of course, Zelda took notice of this and giggled.

"Well then, seems someone is about as much in awe as when we first met. No need to be so shy, we've known each other for a very long time. Now, what's our next move...?"

What is their next move?
1) Zelda decides she should reward the Minizora Hero. She has many ideas...but isn't sure which ones Link will be able to handle~
2) More options

13512.content: All kinds of characters to play with from the Pokemon show? Shall we do the obvious and start with Ash?
13512.title: Pokemon Anime

135121.content:
It had been quite the day for Ash Ketchum. He’d started what was supposed to be the beginning of his epic quest by sleeping in. After that, he had to nag his mom to give him a ride over to Professor Oak’s so that he didn’t miss out on all the best pokemon.

Being a minizoran, Ash had strived for what little independence he could grasp and being a pokemon trainer seemed like his best chance. Since pokeballs could shrink down to fit a minizora, it was technically feasible for them to venture across the land and become brilliant pokemon trainers. However, this course was discouraged by most that feared what might happen to the tiny people all alone. Besides the greater danger posed by wild pokemon, there were also other trainers to contend with. It wasn’t unheard of for minisora who lost in pokemon battles to be kidnapped and kept by the victors as pets or slaves. Such things were illegal, but also really hard to prove as most police didn’t put too much effort into tracking lost minizoran.

Even knowing all of this, Ash still proudly rode atop his mother’s shoulder as she took him to the lab. There he got to scrape the bottom of the barrel and take Professor Oak’s last pokemon, a Pikachu. Things started off rocky and only got worse from there. Understandably, Pikachu was reluctant to obey a trainer shorter than himself. However, things took a turn after a calamitous mistake involving some spearow. Ash then found himself atop his new Pikachu’s head as they ran for dear life. It was only by good luck that they not only came upon a bike, but one equipped to handle a minizora as well as a regular rider. Ash swiped it, vowing to return it as he rode away, the flock of deadly birds still hot on his trail. Fortunately, Pikachu tapped into previously unknown strength and blah, blah, blah. We all know this stuff. Where should our story begin?

Option 1: Misty demands Ash pay for her bike. Since he has no money, he’ll just have to pay in ‘other’ ways.
Option 2: Reader’s choice

135331.content: Should Lara be the minizora or should she find an artifact that brings her to a minizora village?
135331.title: The Original Tomb Raider

135332.content:
Possible Scenarios

1. Lara Croft is born a Minizora but that doesn't stop her from venturing out to find treasures and tombs

2. On a adventure Lara Croft finds a village filled with Minizora's
135332.title: The Reboot Tomb Raider

choices: A Teenager who is normal sized
1353321.content:
Lara is not far form the island, just a couple of hours and she will be there. Its taken Lara a couple of days be she will finally be there.

Lara is born a Minizora, standing at four inches tall but her thrust for adventure is still with her. Lara has been traveling the world and finding artefacts. She has mostly gone alone due to the fear of putting others in danger, she can take care of herself easily but finds it a bit tricky to take care of others especially when they are huge compared to her. Despite her size Lara has never seen it as a disadvantage, she's always seen it as a bit of a challenge and always pushed forward no matter what.

She has got specialised equipment made for her, a boat to fit her size as well as maps, tools and everything else she needs.

Lara's boat hits something causing Lara to jolt awake, she gets up and goes to see what it is. Her heart leaps for joy as she sees that her boat has arrived on the island. She packs up her things and throws her bag on her back. She jumps off the boat and ties it up to a large rock and heads off into the island to see what she can find.

Lara didnt have any set goals on what she wants to find or do. All she wants to do is find what's on the island and explore as she has found no traces on discovery of this island.

Lara wanders around the island for hours and finds that so far its completely deserted. She sighs and wonders if she should give up. She finds somewhere to sit down to catch her breath. Everything sounds so peaceful, Lara wonders if all of this is worth it if nothing is actually here.

There's a loud crack, Lara hears something in the distance. She slowly gets up and wanders out to see what it is.

What is it?
1353321.title: Lara Croft: Minizora

13533211.content:
Lara stops in the shadows when she see's the source of the noise, it was a young boy, probably a teenager, by best guess, with braided, dark hair and lightly tanned skin, especially compared to her naturally milky British skin-tone. He was mostly dressed in furs and leather, with a basket in his hands and a knife on his hip

"So this island is inhabited, and this must be one of the local tribesmen" Lara thinks aloud, already planning on the best way to sneak her way into the village, after following and somehow keeping up with the giant of course. Any plans she had, were immediately lost the moment he turns to grab a plant nearby and spot her.

The adventurer yelps and tries to flee, but the boy is quicker, strong hand clasping around her thin waist with ease and lifting her up to his face. He seemed rather cute though he spoke too quickly for Lara to have any idea what he was saying, unsure if she even recognized the language he was speaking.

"Hello she greets, waving and trying to keep her nerves down "My name is Lara Croft" she adds, smiling in what she hopes was conveyed as friendly

"Lara" the boy repeats, smiling before he drops her into his basket, her fall broken by the plants and berries he'd already gathered that morning. Now trapped in the basket she wondered if it was really a good thing she had found this tribal boy

What happens when he gets back to his village?

1) Mini's are a rarity on this island and are considered messengers from the island Gods
2) Minizora are a 30% possibility in this area, so it's her pale skin and odd clothes rather than her size that had the boy bring her back to be checked out by the elders
3) In this tribe mini's have very few purposes: as pets, toys, or to breed more of them, as they have no other use in the society, but they feel simply killing them is too cruel for simply existing.
13533211.title: Meeting the locals

choices: Rose gives Lara a tour of the house
Lara and Rose talk about a escape plan
135332113.content:
Lara remains in the bottom of the basket as the boy walks into town, Lara climbs up the basket and pokes her head out and looks around. Everything looks so old and mysterious, she's never seen this place on a map before. She knows where this island is properly located but they must be shut off from everyone else. The people in the area are wearing furs and leathers like the boy but everything around them looks a little odd. There are places for blacksmiths and workers making it look a little medieval but the houses and buildings look a bit modern like they came form her place. She's never seen anything like this before her in life.

The boy walks past everything and heads to a small little house sitting at the end of the street. He walks inside and Lara sees an older woman and man along with a young girl sitting at a table eating.

"That must be his family." Lara whispers.

The boy talks to his family and Lara struggles to understand them due to how fast they were speaking. He turns to the young girl and her face lights up as he starts talking. Lara gulps as the young girl's eyes shoot to the basket she is in, while they did talk fast for her she's sure she heard the word toy come out of his mouth.

The young girl reaches into the basket and smiles when she grabs Lara. Lara panics a little as she is pulled out of the basket and brought to this young girl's face who looks to be about eleven or twelve. She smiles widely and begins to pat Lara's head and running her fingers though Lara's brown pony tail.

"Can you please let me go." Lara begs. "I'm not a toy for you to play with, I'm still human."

The girl huffs and storms off tightening her grip around Lara causing her squeal, for such a young girl she had a good grip on her. Lara panics as she knows that she's now a toy to this girl, no matter what she says to her she has no escape. The girl walks into what looks to be her bedroom and slams the door shut. Lara turns white as she feels the shock of the door ripple through her body. The girl plants herself down on the ground and drops Lara hard in a small doll house. Lara rolls onto her side and rubs her knee as it collided with the hard surface.

"Stay!" The girl demands.

Lara whimpers and nods while still holding her knee a little afraid to find out what will happen if she disobeyed. The girl stands up and heads off to finish her meal. Lara lets out a sigh of relief knowing that she wont be played with at the moment. The girl slams her door shut hard on the way out making Lara flinch. For a young girl she has quite a bit of strength a bit of a temper.

Lara sits up and rubs her knee and feels the pain slowly fade. She stands up and looks at the doll house, the girl had dropped her in what looks to be the living room of the place, there's a small couch about her size and other bits and pieces around the place. The doll house looks to be only one story with no proper open doors and windows.

"Somewhere there?" Lara hears someone call out.

"In here." Lara calls out.

Lara's heart skips a beat as she hears someone else. While she's glad she's not alone she's a little nervous to find out who it is. A woman walks into the lounge to see Lara. She looks quite young, long red hair tied up in a pony tail, a curvy figure and a few freckles around her nose.

"I'm Lara Croft." Lara says introducing her.

"Rose," She smiles. "You must be Kyone's new toy."

"Shit," Lara sighs and sits on the couch feeling her knee swell up a bit. Rose sits next to her with a smile.

"It's just so good to see another Minizora around here." Rose smiles.

"Like wise." Lara smirks. "So what should be be fearing when it comes to Kyone?"

"To be honest not much." Rose sighs. "If you play along and do as she says you'll have fun and she'll be really nice to you, play up and you could be getting punished."

"Its so wrong of her to treat us like this." Lara says.

"I know but she can get away with it." Rose sighs. "Everyone here can."

"Why?" Lara asks.

"On this island Minizora's are just treated as disposable," Rose explains. "Its not like home where Minizoras get to be treated as equal. It's up to the giant what happens to the Minziroa hence why I'm a girls toy."

"So you're not from around here are you?" Lara asks sitting up.

"No." Rose sighs tensing up a little.

"So how did you get here?" Lara asks. "How long have you been here?"

"Last year my boyfriend and I along with some friends came out to this part of the ocean for a boat party as we just graduated high school so she thought we'd celebrate." Rose sighs. "There was a bad storm and the boat crashed. I washed ashore the island and was caught by a local. I was then sold to this family who gave me to Kyone as a birthday present."

Lara sees that Rose is about to cry so she wraps her arms around the red head and holds her close while gently stroking her back.

"Now that I'm here, I promise if you stick with me we will get out of here and get you home." Lara smiles.

"How can you be so sure?" Rose asks with a few tears rolling down her checks.

"Because I pretty much do this for a living," Lara smirks. "Getting myself into situations like this because I stumbled onto unknown lands. Getting caught by a child is a walk in the park for me.

"My hero then," Rose giggles.

"And my boat is still on the island so we have a way out." Lara smiles. "It's more about getting out of here and there."

Rose giggles and cries a little more, only this time it was tears of joy.

"For my birthday yesterday I wished that someone would come and save me and here you are." Rose giggles.

"Happy birthday Rose." Lara smiles. "I'm here to make your birthday wish come true, how old did you turn?"

"Nineteen." Rose says wiping a few tears form her cheeks.

"I promise I'll get you home Rose," Lara smiles.

"Thanks Lara." Rose smiles.
135332113.title: New Pet and Friend

choices: This is going to be a long day
1353321131.content:
"Well, since you'll be staying with me for most likely a long while, let me give you a tour of the house. Remember the front and back yard are non existant as we can't afford a front or back door" Rose says, trying to raise both their spirits "This here is the living room, where I can sit and wish I was anywhere else but here, or play some of Kyone's tamer games. There is what is technically a kitchen/dining room, where food is left for me on a daily basis my Kyone or her mother, and finally a bedroom, and unless they make you one we'll be sharing the bed, luckily it is more than big enough for 2" she winks but her mouth is pulled into a grimace that worries Lara

"Who's Miku?"

"Kyone's cousin. She has a couple of mini toys herself, local boys. This means they're well built, well endowed for their size, know their place on the totem pole and more importantly that I'm just as disposable as they are. I hate when she comes over and they play house, the only consolation I see is I don't have to entertain them both now you're here" she sighs tiredly "Sorry, but it's not fun being manhandled and roughhoused by 2 mini lads, a child and a mid teen probably getting off on her pets destroying Kyone's pet, aka me"

"Well news flash rose, I'm not letting them hurt you again" Lara declares determined to keep the other girl safe and sound, hard to go against giant anythings and do that though.

The moment of peace was broken when she heard the door open and someone step inside, who was it?

1) Kyone, she's back to play withe her dolls
2) Kiseme, Kyone was staying at friends tonight, giving the mother a chance to play with her daughter's toys
3) Kyone and Miku, ready to play, the older girl even brought her pets to make things interesting
1353321131.title: Rose gives Lara a tour of the house

13533211311.content:
"Oh thank god." Rose sighs as the see Kyone return with a smile on her face.

"How is this good?" Lara asks.

"I never said it was." Rose smirks. "It's just better than the two others who would only use us a sex toys."

"True," Lara sighs.

Lara and Rose stand in the doll house with their gaze just locked on the giant young girl entering. She skips inside the room and plonks herself down in front of the doll house. "She can understand us though right?" Lara asks.

"She does but its all depending on what you say." Rose says. "Not that she doesn't understand but she would just chose not to listen if you say something she doesn't like."

Kyone smiles and reaches in towards Lara. She curls her giant fingers around Lara and lifts her in the air before she has a chance to react. Lara squeaks a bit as Krone's grip is very tight around her. She is brought up to the giant girl's soft smiling face. Lara can't help but gently smile back, hopefully the giant girl's soft smile will represent what's coming next.

Kyone places her giant finger on Lara's head and gently rubs it. Lara smirks a little as it does feel kind of nice. Her giant finger travels down and makes contact with Lara's breasts and gives them a gentle squeeze.

"Hey!" Lara squeals.

Kyone just giggles and starts to gently rub Lara's breasts with a finger each. Lara turns bright red and bites her bottom lip holding her moans in. The last thing she needs is to be fondled by a preteen girl.

Lara lets out a sigh of relief as Kyone removes her fingers form her breasts before setting her down beside Rose. Kyone says something Lara can't really understand then giggles causing Rose to blush.

"What did she say?" Lara asks.

"She's says she likes your breasts and thinks they are better than mine." Rose says blushing avoiding Lara's gaze.

Lara blushes just as much Rose unsure what to make of all this. Kyone smiles and just looks at her two dolls wondering what she should play with them.


What does Kyone want to play?
13533211311.title: Kyone's Playtime

1353331.content: Who's going to be small?
1353331.title: Overwatch

choices: The Bite-Sized Brother of Overwatch’s Mascot
The Mighty Minuscule Recruit of Overwatch
13533311.content:
Timmy was only a Minizora boy of ten years when he and his brother Brian witnessed one of the greatest fights between heroes vs. villains inside the Overwatch Museum. Overwatch vs. Talon. Winston and Tracer vs. Widowmaker and Reaper over Doomfist’s powerful gauntlet.

He remembered his Brian ordered his tiny brother to stay hidden as he set him up on the stand obscured by the broken glass. Then Brian went out and helped the two famous Overwatch agents beat the Talon agents by using their own arm-shaped payload against them.

When Widowmaker and Reaper retreated, Timmy remembered how Tracer herself carried him in her soft, leather glove and told the two boys, “You know, the world could use more heroes.” That was the greatest day of the boys’ lives.

Not more than six months later passed by since then that the boys never stopped thinking about that day. Unfortunately, tragedy struck when Talon struck the shopping mall Timmy and his family went shopping at. Talon soldiers devastated the mall and everyone in it, except for a handful of survivors kidnapped to be used for Moira’s experiments, Timmy included. Timmy was the only Minizora taken by Talon, which intrigued Moira to the point where she focused most of her attention on experimenting on him. After discovering Timmy’s high physical durability and immunity to stomach acids, Timmy was often tortured by Widowmaker and teased by Sombra for two straight months.

Then after the second month passed, salvation came for the traumatized Minizora when the female members of Overwatch took the Talon base by surprise, resulting in the rescue of three-quarters of the prisoners still alive. Tracer, who led the charge, found the tiny boy locked away in Moira’s office, huddled in his little energized cage. Tracer spent most of her time comforting the grieving Minizora boy in the aftermath.

Later, it was decided by Mercy and Tracer that the latter would adopt the tiny Timmy as her own little brother and be allowed to live with her and her lesbian partner, Emily. In addition, Timmy had to attend weekly psychiatric sessions with Mercy to help him with his psychological trauma from witnessing his family’s demise and being kept prisoner by Talon. Every day of the week, Timmy would be educated by the brilliant minds of Mei, D.Va, and Efi Oladele (with whom he falls in love with) to make up for the months of formal education lost in captivity.

Months after becoming a part of Tracer’s family and psychiatric sessions with Mercy, Timmy decided the only way for him to become brave was to train and become a member of Overwatch. Through training from various female members, and with the help of Hammond the mechanical genius hamster, Timmy is recruited into Overwatch as not only its youngest member to join, but also the first Minizora to do so. With the help of his new family, Timmy, the bite-sized Minizora boy is determined to avenge his old one.

Which part of Timmy’s life are we going to explore?
13533311.title: Timmy

choices: Two Months Later, Overwatch Rescues Timmy
135333111.content:
t was supposed to be a good day for young Timmy and his family as they were all shopping at the shopping mall. There was him, his parents, and his older brother, Brian, who he admired for his heroics in the Overwatch Museum half a year back.

But things changed when the terrorist organization, Talon attacked.

Timmy remembered that moment when the Omnics, war machines hacked by Talon, caught their parents in the line of fire. They were among two of the two hundred expendable victims rained down by bullets from Talon’s men and machines. Timmy and Brian took cover in the shadows cast by the pillars, the benches, and the potted plants, helplessly watching as the civilians were mercilessly slaughtered by Talon, hearing their victims scream in terror and falling silently to the overwhelming gunfire.

Brian took a peek and spotted a phone on the other side of his hiding area. Knowing what had to be done, he firmly instructed Timmy to remain in his hiding area as he went for the phones. Stealthy as Brian was, when he tried contacting the police for help, his whispers attracted the attention of two Talon soldiers aiming their weapons at him. Timmy watched in horror as Brian, his older brother and hero, was shot and fell to the floor with a sickening thunk!, a puddle of blood pooling around him. Timmy gasped too loudly, and by the time he covered his mouth, the Talon soldiers moved in on him, their weapons raised at him.

Just before someone pulled the trigger, one of the Talon soldiers stopped the other from shooting the boy and received an order to take any survivor back to their base. The Talon soldier then grabbed Timmy by the arm and dragged the screaming, crying boy away from the scene of his family’s slaughter. He, among dozens of other crying survivors, were forced outside by gunpoint and taken to an aerial mobile carrier in the parking lot. Out of the victims who were taken, Timmy was the youngest.

The aerial carrier carried the kidnapped victims to Talon’s secret base somewhere in a snowy mountain range, where exactly, Timmy couldn’t tell. When the ship arrived at the base, the victims were forcefully disembarked and led into a dark corridor, thrown into energy cells designed to prevent them from escaping. The boy was surrounded by dark armored assailants with weapons and the dozens of people crying for the trauma of the wanton carnage, the deaths of their friends and families, or the fear for their lives. Timmy cried for all of the above.

Not long after they were locked, the doors opened, and through that door came three of the dangerous women in Talon: Moira, the Irish mad scientist; Sombra, the Spanish hacker and chameleon; and Widowmaker, the French femme fatale sniper. Timmy gasped and curled up in a ball, hoping that Widowmaker wouldn’t notice him because he was there when Brian slugged her with Doomfist’s gauntlet, the very weapon which she sought to ascertain and failed to do so.

“This is a lovely batch of test subjects our troops have collected,” Moira observed, admiring the variety of poor victims in her own sadistic glee. “Each of these subjects has the potential to become a part of something grand, something that will not only defeat Overwatch once and for all, but expand the science of borders to new horizons. For this, we need only choose one for our molecular compression veil. Now, who shall it be?”

As the three villainesses passed his cell, Timmy peeked from his curled position and caught a sneak peak. His scared eyes connected with Widomaker’s, and he quickly backed down. He shivered and internally prayed that the pale blue sniper did not recognize him, but the sound of high heels striding towards his cell confirmed his fear. “You zhere, boy!” Widowmaker called, banging on the cell’s energy field. “Yes, you, I seem to recall zhat face! Show eet to me now!”

With one giant bang against the field, Timmy jumped from his curling position. It took one look between the scared boy and the femme fatale for Widowmaker to suddenly get heated, unsheath her signature rifle, and aim her gun at the cowering boy. “I knew it! I know who you are, boy! You were zhere when your brother humiliated me in zhe museum!” Widowmaker screamed, making Timmy cower and cry. “Your brother ruined our operation to retrieve Doomfist’s gauntlet! Now you must pay!”

“Hold on, so that chico’s brother was the one who slugged you with Doomfist’s gauntlet?” Sombra asked, suddenly bursting out with laughter. “Oh, dama araña, that must have been embarrassing for you!”

“Mord ta langue, Sombra!” Widowmaker barked at the Spanish hacker. “His brother humiliated me, and he must pay for his brother’s crimes!”

Being someone with no remorse, Widowmaker had no qualms with killing kids, especially one who was involved with her failure for her mission to retrieve Doomfist’s gauntlet. Just as she was about to squeeze the trigger, a clawed hand belonging to the skinny redheaded belonging to Moira gently shoved the gun away. “As much as I enjoy a revenge killing from time to time, Widowmaker, I would advise restraining your impulses for the time being,” Moira said, approaching the boy’s cell. “Right now, I would personally like to inspect the boy.”

Moira nodded her head towards one of the Talon soldiers, and the soldier disabled the energy field. WIth a quick swipe, Moira tightly grabbed the boy’s wrist, the vice-like grip preventing him from fleeing and the vice grip feeling like it would crush his little bones. “Ow! Owww! Please, let me go! You’re hurting me!” Timmy begged, thrashing in her grip to break free.

“Quit struggling, boy. I am only going to inspect your vitals,” Moira said as she pulled up a holovid medical file on the boy.

Timmy sobbed and cried as Moira’s tight grip hurt his wrist. Moira carefully inspected the vitals with childlike curiosity. “Hmmm… oh… I see…” Moira swiped the holovid away and closely inspected the boy’s sobbing face, holding his cheeks with one hand underneath his chin. “Ahhh… yes, this is perfect. You are young, your body is constantly changing, and your vitality seems healthy enough for you to become my first test subject.”

Moira then proceeded down the corridor, dragging the boy with her.

“Ahhh! Where are you taking me!?” Timmy screamed.

“You are coming with me,” Moira answered. “You should be honored for being the first and youngest test subject for my latest experiment.”

“No! Let me go, I don’t wanna be your test subject!” Timmy screamed. “Someone, help me!”

Timmy’s pleas for aid echoed in deaf ears as he was led down the dark corridor and on the other side of a hexagonal door. Moira dragged the crying boy into her laboratory, an expansive white room with a desk and a computer, and a few ominous chambers with metal reclining hospital beds. The mad scientist left the soldiers to forcibly restrain the boy to one of the tables in the designated chamber as she typed in a few commands and prepared for its activation.

“Wait! What are you going to do me!?” Timmy demanded to know as he struggled against the restraints.

“You are going to be the first test subject of my matter reduction veil,” Moira informed the boy as she typed in the commands. “To put it lightly, this veil of radiation will reduce your size until you are 1/10 of your original size. Simply put, since you are 4 ft in height for your age, you will he reduced to 0.4 inches.”

“Y-You’re going to shrink me!?”

“Quite right. I look forward to the results of the experiment, and given your healthy vitality and growth, there is a 67.85% chance of success.” Moira reached to the controls, and gripped the lever. “Once this experiments succeeds, you will have the honor of becoming the breakthrough we needed to reduce the Earth’s overpopulation. Every shrunken human will struggle to survive in a world where the insects can crush them as the humans did their own species, Talon will stand high and mighty above those puny people, and no one, not even Overwatch can stop us.”

“Please, don’t! I’m begging you!” Timmy cried for his life, thrashing In his tight restraints.

“You don’t have any choice in this matter, young one.” Moira pulled down the lever, and the chamber whirred and hummed with life. “Now prepare yourself, boy, because your life will change in the biggest way possible!”

Timmy whimpered and screamed as he tried to escape the restraints, but he couldn’t even budge. As he vainly tried to set himself free, an overhead arch began to spin around the table where the boy was held. It spun faster and faster until it was a speeding blur. From the top of the arch, purple light sparked and crackled, forming a radioactive circle that slowly descended down the arch. Timmy’s struggles became more frantic as the radiation passed over him and through his body, subjecting him to shocking torture. His screams echoed in a bright flash of light.

When the radiation disappeared, the chamber’s humming faded away. The door was unlocked and automatically opened for Moira and her female companions to enter. As they did, they saw the metal bed was completely devoid of the young boy. Upon closer inspection, Moira gently scooped up something she spotted in the center of the bed and curled both hands around it. She turned to Widowmaker and Sombra with a triumphant smirk.

“Behold,” she said as she uncupped her hands, revealing the shrunken form of Timmy in her palm, clothes and all. He took one look at the giant faces of the villainesses and screamed, curling himself against the palm and hiding his face away from the giants’ gazes.

“With the matter reduction veil fully operational, now the real experiment can begin,” Moira said, an evil spark glistening in her eye.

Who do we follow next, and what will they do to Timmy?
135333111.title: The Tiny Prisoner of Talon

choices: “...we’re taking you to see (Mei/Hana/Efi) for your lessons.”

135333112.content:
Link to chapter in Small Shotas Redux: https://www.writing.com/main/interactive...

The holovid hands of Big Ben struck six forty-five in early morning in Great Britain. The ring of the tower’s legendary bells echoed sweetly over London, waking up everyone who lived near the tower in the city. In one such apartment, a certain couple was stirred awake by the bells of Big Ben while the morning light cast its first glow.

One half of said couple was Lena Oxton, widely known as the time-slipping hero Tracer. Her sweet eyes fluttered and woke up to the most beautiful face on the planet in her eyes. A beautiful face decorated with freckles amid of a sea of orange-red hair. That face had a name, and it was Emily.

Emily inhaled deeply and let her eyes flutter open to the sight of the most adorable face on the planet. A face with the sweetest, childish eyes, a cute button nose, and brown spiky hair parted to the right side of her face. Her lips spread with a smile as she went in met her lips with Lena’s, giving each other a passionate good morning kiss.

“Good morning, beautiful,” Emily whispered in a slight Scottish brogue.

“Good morning, love,” Lena whispered back, wrapping her arms around Emily’s abdomen and pulling her closer, the redhead returning the courtesy and kissing her on the lips. “I had an awful dream last night. Overwatch finally defeated the Null Sector and Talon, and the world was entirely at peace again.”

“And what was so awful about that dream?” Emily asked.

“I didn’t have a sexy redhead beside me to celebrate our victory,” Lena answered with a playful pout.

“Awww, you poor baby. Here, let me make it up to you with some kisses.” Emily planted little butterfly kisses on Lena’s cheek and moved her lips towards the side of her neck. Lena giggled, protested, and writhed underneath the ticklish, yet stimulating sensation of her girlfriend hitting her ticklish spot. The mascot of Overwatch didn’t want this feeling to stop anytime soon, and to be frankly, neither did her lover.

The bells of Big Ben echoed outside their apartment walls. By the time the toll hit seven, both Lena and Emily finished their morning cuddling and kissing, basking in the afterglow of their love.

“It’s seven o’clock, love,” Lena informed her redhead lover, pecking her on the lips. “It’s about that time to wake up Timmy.”

“Aye, we can’t afford to have him sleeping in, what with the day that’s been planned and all,” Emily agreed.

“What say you put on the tea while I wake him up?” Lena offered.

“Fine, but only if you promise to make the eggs in the basket today,” Emily retorted.

“It’s a deal.” With one gentle kiss, Emily got up, put on her sweatpants, and walked over to the kitchen while Lena rolled over to the nightstand. On that nightstand was a doll-sized bed from Emily’s old dollhouse, and sleeping comfortably in that bed was the tiny ten year-old boy Lena and Emily adopted as their little brother.

Lena couldn’t help but gush over how adorable her tiny surrogate brother looked sleeping in the doll-sized bed. With two giant fingers, Lena gently wiggles them on Timmy’s sleeping form, trying to stir him awake. “Oy. Timmy, it’s time to wake up, little brother.”

Timmy whimpered in his sleep. “Just five more minutes,” he said, turning over to his side away from Lena’s face.

“Come on, Timmy, get up,” Lena whispered, but was only met with deaf ears. Then her lips spread with her signature sly smile. “Timmy, if you don’t get up, then I’m gonna give you little nibbles all over.”

She then lowered her lips and smacked them repeatedly across Timmy’s body, tickling him awake. He screamed and wriggled, laughing hysterically as the giantess tickled his tiny frame with tiny butterfly kisses which seemed like a full body tickle. The tiny ten year-old rolled on his bed, clutching his belly as Lena gave him one big kiss on his head.

“Ah, good, you’re finally awake!” Lena gently scooped the permanently shrunken boy up into her hands, gently clasped them into a gentle hold around him, and once again planted another kiss on his head, making him giggle. “Good morning, love! Did you have a nice little kip last night?”

“Mm-hmm,” Timmy mumbled, wiping away the crust from his eye.

“And did you have any dreams?”

“Mm-mmm.”

Lena felt a sense of relief from that. She and Emily had witnessed Timmy suffering from nightmares and panic attacks while he slept, a clear sign of post-traumatic stress in this young child.

“That’s good. A kip with no dreams is better than a kip with bad dreams, that’s what I figure,” Lena said, gently lowering her palm to Timmy’s tiny feet, offering him a lift.

Timmy took his giant surrogate sister up on her offer and stepped aboard. Everything lifted as Timmy was gently boosted up to the level of Lena’s pursed lips, planting a gentle full-body kiss on his side, making him giggle. “Come on, Emily is putting on the tea, and I’m putting on the eggs.”

“Yay! I love your eggs!” Timmy cheered.

“So does Emily. That’s why she wanted me to make them.” Lena gently deposited her little brother onto her shoulder and gave him time to hold on tight until she started walking out the bedroom. To Timmy, riding on Tracer’s or Emily’s shoulders was like riding a thrill ride at the fair, vertigo-so ducking heights included. He rode that ride all the way as Lena entered the kitchen where the two giant lesbians exchanged another good morning kiss and Emily gave Timmy one of her own.

Lena was glad that Emily accepted the tiny boy into their lives. Lena always told her red-haired lover about the boys who stepped in her fight against Widowmaker and Reaper and helped them win. When she told Emily about the tragedy Timmy endured, Emily was heartbroken since she wanted to meet the boy’s brother and thank him for aiding her. They along with their friends at Overwatch helped Timmy through his PTSD from witnessing his family’s slaughter and the torture at the hands, feet, and stomachs of Talon’s femme fatales.

Every week, Lena would take Timmy to see Dr. Angela Ziegler, the healing hero known as Mercy, for his therapeutic appointments. A few times on the weekdays, Lena would take him to see Mercy, Mei, Hana, or Efi Ofadele to be educated since he was too small to attend an educational institution. From first glance, Tracer could tell Timmy was in love with Efi because of the way he was shy around her. She often teased him about his crush, just like any sister would do their sibling.

That’s how it was for the past two months. Timmy was fortunate enough to be a survivor of one of Talon’s most deplorable attacks on humanity. He lost a family and came out scarred, but he found a new family in the women associated with Overwatch.

Lena banded Timmy over to Emily, who gently dropped him off on her shoulder while she went and prepared the eggs. Emily and Timmy watched the British morning news programs anchored by an Omnic and his female human co-anchor, the giantess sipping on her tea while the tiny boy slumped against her neck. Lena prepared two eggs in a basket, the traditional eggs cooked in the hole of the bread in a frying pan. She made sure to shrink the portions of bread, butter, and eggs to accommodate Timmy’s size.

When breakfast was made, the two women and their permanently shrunken brother ate their breakfast in peace. It was a morning of peace to start off the day right. When Lena finished off the last of her breakfast, she wiped away the crumbs from her hands and turned to Timmy, enthralled by the images on the TV.

“Oh, Timmy,” Lena called to Timmy, grabbing his attention as he had his egg halfway into his mouth. “After breakfast is done, we’d better get you dressed up and ready because today...”

135333222211.content:
"Morning mama" Lemon greets with an adorable yawn, making Peach giggle at the cuteness

"Hello sweetie" Peach coos, remembering how lucky she was to have him.

7 years ago the princess realized she wanted to be a parent, she had experience given how incompetent and needing of supervision 94% of Toads were so knew children would be easy in comparison, she just needed a way to have one. Luckily at the time her kingdom was peacefully co-existing with the Koppa kingdom, Bowser even attending the monthly gokarting races with his kids (she's pretty sure Iggy cheats though). It meant she could go to Kamic and simply ask him to give her a child magically. The koppa was happy to provide, giving her a potion which would cause her to experience an accelerated pregnancy, lasting only 4 months. What he didn't tell her, was the reduced time was because the child would be a minizora. Regardless of that Peach was still overjoyed when the time came and her little Lemon was the talk of the kingdoms, stealing the hearts of his Uncles Mario, Luigi and Toad, as well as his Aunt Daisy and Rosalie, not to mention Wendy Koopa, who has demanded the mini's hand in marriage on each of her birthdays since he arrived.

"You Ok mom? You zoned out" Lemon calls, snapping the royal out of her musings

"I'm fine sweetie, lets go have some breakfast an have some fun" Peach promises, getting happy cheers from her tiny son

What now?

1) Delegates from another neighboring kingdom have arrived, Peach having to spend the day in meetings, while Lemon meets the ambassador's own kids,
2) Taking a leaf out of her papa's book, Wendy Koopa arrives to kidnap Lemon
3) Peach's Moon-cousin Rosalie arrives, wanting to play with her favorite nephew
